Reviews.Title: “No water to take a shower before leaving for the airport!”
Reviews.Author: Marchouston1987
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great, except for a big problem. No water to take a shower. None at all. Now I'm on the rail headed to the airport to sit on a plane for 4 hours. All they offered was to comp my breakfast. Not interested. Not staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “Mystery overcharge ruins otherwise good experience”
Reviews.Author: william l
Reviews.Content: A couple of days after I checked out I noticed a $11 dollar charge from the Red Lion on my Visa. I e-mailed and received a follow-up bill that noted a breakfast charge at the Terrace Restaurant. Problem was, we had not set foot in the hotel restaurant. I e-mailed a couple of times and asked for the charge to be reversed, but did not receive any response. $11 is not a lot of money, and it's not worth my time to try to chase hotel staff to respond to me, but it's quite irritating that nobody from the hotel answered my e-mails. At least it wasn't a larger overcharge of say $111.00 Otherwise, I liked the location, the room was clean, and the staff were friendly. I had one room keycard that didn't seem to work. Parking is tight. And the hotel should have responded to my e-mail regarding the overcharge.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay!”
Reviews.Author: CORedTraveler
Reviews.Content: A great hotel! I stayed on the 20th floor with an awesome view of Pike's Place Market. The staff is very friendly. The rooms are superb and have lots of room. The food is very good. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Needs upgrade of heat - a/c”
Reviews.Author: CAPatty
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel in a great location, just up the street from Pike Market. The rooms are clean and spacious and the wifi works great. The pub downstairs is extremely convenient since there is little other dining choices nearby in the evening. However, I would hesitate to return. The fan system runs 24/7, and if you have allergies or otherwise don't like cold air blowing on you all night, it can make your stay uncomfortable. There is a temperature knob that can be turned (but it was cold air no matter what). You have no option to turn the fan off. Maintenance came and said there were other complaints, but the option offered was to bring a space heater. Not good. I called again and was told that the heat was working completely normally. I asked to be moved, but checked another room and it was just as cold.

Reviews.Title: “If you don't mind having to ask for the obvious . . .”
Reviews.Author: SKA2012
Reviews.Content: I stayed 6 nights and had issues over the course of the stay including: items in the room not being replenished (i.e., coffee, cups); keys not working (remade literally 5 times); ice machine was broken the entire length of my stay; a purchase at the restaurant was billed to my room even though I had paid for it with my credit card - and upon check-out had to pay for it again until I showed my on-line bank statement proving I had already paid for it; and a thrermostat that was set at 64 degrees but did not keep the room cool. Lots of money to be that frustrated for a week. When I brought one of these many problems to the hotel's attention, people were nice about helping, for the most part. But I went on a trip to enjoy my stay, not to have to address a bunch of avoidable issues. I seriously could not recommend this hotel, very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Red Lion Hotel on 5th - would definitely stay there again”
Reviews.Author: MJC1357
Reviews.Content: Just stayed for 3 days at the Red Lion Hotel with my husband and 9 year old son - and thoroughly recommend the hotel. The location is perfect - central to everything. We had breakfast twice in the hotel and couldn't fault the buffet selection - service was great, everyone was helpful and friendly. Hotel room was a good size, beds were comfy and the room was spotless. Other reviewers have commented on the noise - we happened to be there for St Patricks Day, and yes, we heard the people next door coming in at around 2.00am (slamming doors) but I think that this was due to inconsiderate guests, rather than the hotel. Elephant & Castle pub and restaurant (joined to the hotel) is family friendly - food and service both good and excellent value for money. We would definitely return to the Red Lion Hotel - we found every member of staff to be friendly and helpful and really couldn't find fault with this hotel at all. Great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, perfect location. Nice and quiet!!!”
Reviews.Author: Bayboy56
Reviews.Content: This hotel is five blocks fron the Pike Place Market on Pike St. In the middle of everything. Macy's is one block away. Can't get a better location. I am a light sleeper and truly appreciate a quiet hotel. This place is really quiet and well built. (stayed on St. Pat's day) Get a high floor for a great view. Has underground parking ($32 overnight) and a Elephant & Castle Restaurant. Decent pub fare without leaving the building. I will be back here.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: MaryTee
Reviews.Content: We really found this hotel great for our needs. Good location, great food, clean, overall I am very pleased for the amount I paid and will recommend.

Reviews.Title: “We won't return”
Reviews.Author: appleorchard
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed on both of our stays. We arrived very late (after flight snafus) and our room was very cold. Upon calling down to the desk, they said they would send someone up to check and this person never arrived. They said they would send blankets right up, they never arrived that night. After a chilly and very poor sleep, we checked with the desk the next morning to inquire about the heat - again, not much of a response. We asked for amenity items (razor, shower cap, etc.) since we did not have our luggage due to airline snafu, but all the items were not delivered. When we returned to our room later in the day, they put in a space heater (!) and finally blankets arrived. We would have checked out, but too late due to cancellation fee. They did discount our room rate, which was appreciated, but did not make up for the miserable cold night. We left the hotel for travel to Vancouver, and then returned to the Red Lion a few days later before our flight home, and found that the hotel was overbooked (overheard a desk clerk) and were not able to get into our room until well after check-in of 3:00. The computer system also went down a few times during the afternoon, delaying check in for many other guests. To be fair, they then upgraded us to a suite, but it did not make up for very disappointing stays. There are better options in the area (Sheraton, Westin) which we will try on our next visit to Seattle. This hotel needs to try much harder to provide customer service to their guests and upgrade their facility.

Reviews.Title: “Shower was horrible!”
Reviews.Author: yvettenicole21
Reviews.Content: Loved the room, location,price, and employees! Front desk clerk was awesome, my only complaint was the shower, absolutely horrendous!! Wanted to take a hot shower but couldn't relax, who wants a hand held shower head with lukewarm water? Again I would stay here again just hope I get a better shower :-)

Reviews.Title: “Understated Class”
Reviews.Author: Arthur H
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed a few nights here at the end of a cross-country adventure. Friendly and helpful staff, immaculate room, great experience. It was my first time in Seattle and I'm glad I chose the Red Lion - it's at the center of everything. I could park my car and stroll down to the market, take a jaunt to Pioneer Square, marvel at the ultra-modern library...long story short, the Red Lion made Seattle easy. I would return in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer D
Reviews.Content: This is located perfectly. An easy walk to Pike Place and the shopping area. All staff were courteous and helpful. Hotel was clean and room was spacious. I am surprised it is not listed higher here. For the price I absolutely reccomend it, and when I am in Seattle again I plan on staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Location and friendly staff make this a great stay.”
Reviews.Author: rexaboyd
Reviews.Content: Friendly accommodating staff.  Clean, comfortable, well fitted out  rooms with 37" flat screen TVs.  Coffee/tea making equipment and a mini fridge.  Iron, board, robes & free WIFI round out the amenities. The HVAC system doesn't allow much temperature control, depending upon your room location.  Location is fantastic. Within a 15 minute walk are Pike's Market, the waterfront and too many excellent restaurants to list. Shopping of every kind surrounds the hotel.  A bit of England is available below the hotel in The Elephant & Castle pub.   Parking in downtown Seattle is expensive and if you can forgo renting a car while in town, do so. Transportation from the airport to downtown via a private car service is about $45.00. There is excellent public transportation in the Seattle area with service from the airport. See TripAdvisor's review of Seattle/King County transit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: ITA_And_RE_a
Reviews.Content: So nice to have a real breakfast and truly free parking included with our stay. We would definitely visit again. Right in the center of downtown.Walking distance to everything.Great location. We had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Not great”
Reviews.Author: Erika C
Reviews.Content: While the location is fantastic and the room was a good size, that's about all of the positives I have to say. The water temperature was lukewarm. It can be very cold in Seattle in the winter months and to not be able to turn up the temperature on the shower was ridiculous. I called down to the front desk two times to report the water siutation and even spoke to the manager on duty and they always said they would send a maintenance person up to look at the problem. They never let me know what transpired and the water temperature stayed the same. I have no idea if someone actually even came up to look. There was no acknowledgement or anything. Further, the gym is in horrible working condition. I tried 3 different treadmills. The first two didn't work at all (but of course no signs to indicate as much) and the third one kept giving me an error that there was no user on the belt so I had to keep hitting enter probably every 3 minutes for my entire workout. The stair climber didn't work either, but again, no signage. Finally, wireless was spotty at best. I travel a bit for work and have never come across a hotel that is in such a good location but lacks basic things like a hot shower!

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Christmas get away!”
Reviews.Author: Neutrogena06
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 3 nights in December in a King sound view room. The most important thing to us was that it was QUIET – not a lot of street noise. I have stayed downtown Seattle before and it was extremely loud from the sirens and general street noise. Not the case in the room we had at the Red Lion. Our room was pleasant, clean and sufficiently roomy. The color pallet was not so pleasant. They choose such dark wood colors that the room felt a bit like a cave. Given that the daylight wasn’t very long, it would have been nice to have a brighter room – made it feel like perpetual night. That being said – the room’s color was about my only complaint! The bed was extremely comfortable, and I mean truly comfortable. Since this hotel is perfectly located downtown, it made it perfect for us to walk to Top Pot doughnuts (for foodies), walk to Pike’s Place Market and Westgate Center, ride the monorail to Seattle Center, and metro buses everywhere and you are in the ride free zone. We didn’t have to take the car out of the garage the whole trip. Beware of the garage fees which are an extra $30 per night for parking!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Downtown Seattle Location”
Reviews.Author: Suzy_Laura
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for New Year's Eve weekend and to celebrate my 40th birthday. We were originally going to stay at the Westin, but chose the Red Lion as a more affordable alternative in the downtown core. We weren't disappointed. Check in was fast and a luggage cart was available for hauling suitcases and shopping from a stop at the outlet mall on the way. When we arrived at the room, they had some soft music playing and a bottle of wine, flowers and chocolate covered strawberries waiting for me. My friend in Vancouver had arranged for these with the concierge, Susan. My friend reports the concierge was extremely service-oriented and very pleasant to deal with - she drove out of her way to buy my favourite wine, which they didn't have in stock at the hotel. We didn't experience the thin walls that others have reported. I don't recall hearing our neighbours at all. Some of the common areas are a bit marked up, but the room itself was decorated nicely and was clean and comfortable. We booked the room rate that includes parking, which I'd recommend as it is otherwise about $40 a day. The hotel is about 2 blocks from Nordstrom and other stores and about 4 blocks from Pike Place Market. There's a Starbucks across the street and a place to get your nails done right next door (Julep Nail Parlor). The Elephant & Castle Pub is downstairs from the hotel. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: kerrihop
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while attending a conference at the Washington State Convention Center. Super close to Pike Place Market. Clean comfortable rooms with a nice view of the harbor. The lounge also had a great view of the sunset. The only issue I had here was when I was trying to call for a taxi during rush hour.

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown location for decent Seattle hotel”
Reviews.Author: RugbyGuy1087
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the location and price for this hotel. Search out special rates including breakfast and parking on their website. Our room was recently updated and quite nice, but the hallways, etc. need some work. Restaurant/pub downstairs is fine for a casual meal. Most of all, just enjoy the sites of downtown Seattle (including the waterfront) for a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alice L
Reviews.Content: The hotel location can't be beat. It's just 4 blocks away from Pikes Market and various water front restaurants and attractions. It is also centrally located near tons of shopping! House keeping failed to clean our room one day so we dialed housekeeping to inquire why. They said it wasn't cleaned because we probably had the Do Not Disturb placard hanging. I know for sure it wasn't as we are diligent about removing it when we leave for the day. However, they said they would send someone up immediately so we went downstairs to wait in the lobby. We figured 30 minutes should be sufficient time, but when we returned to our room, it still wasn't cleaned. While the hotel boasts it provides free wifi (and numerous hotspots throughout the hotel), it is extremely spotty. When you do receive connection, it is extremely slow. We utilized the internet to locate attractions and obtain directions. Even the computer provided by the hotel had horrible internet connection! The parking fee is also extremely high! Other than it's awesome location, the hotel is just mediocre.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Amazazing Staff!”
Reviews.Author: harbie04
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent the weekend there with our pup and can't say enough about how wonderful the staff was. Everyone from the parking attendents to the wait staff and housekeepers were friendly and so polite and helpful. The Garden Terrace dinner left me speechless! The best salmon I have ever had by far and I found the prices while higher than I would like to pay they were in line with the other hotels in the area and the food was wonderful and 5 star. There were some issues that we experienced during our stay that made the rating drop. As others have stated the walls are thinner than paper therefore you can hear EVERYTHING including the toilets being flushed in other rooms. We were there for 3 nights and the first night the 20 somethings that occupied the room next to us felt they needed to come home at 1:30am and share the entire night out they just had with all that would hear as they were yelling and laughing and slamming doors. The positive was that after we called security (the came up within 3 mins) they were quiet. They had moved elsewhere but when they returned an hour and a bit later they were loud again but only for a short time. Our second night was wonderful. The party crowd checked out and we had a great sleep until the last night when they checked in a young couple with a newborn that screamed ALL NIGHT til 3 am. They really need to think about where they place people especailly when the hotel is not even close to being full and we specifically requested a quiet room since we have experienced similar issues in the past. Do not put a baby next us if there is a chance it may scream all night. It's like going into a resturaunt that's almost empty and they seat you next to the rowdiest table in the place. A little common sense would be great. The front staff were more than willing to fix the issue as best they could and since our stay was by using points they asked if comping our parking would be fair and we agreed. We will be returning just because of the staff. It's in a great location to everything. You are within blocks to Macy's, Nordstroms and Pike Place witha Starbucks on every other corner and many other bakeries and cafes to try. I look forward to our return

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad place, but thin walls and average housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: Gobuckeyes11
Reviews.Content: Very convienent to downtown activities. The desk staff and concierege were very friendly and attentive. During our stay we had to switch rooms after a few nights. The thin walls made it difficult to sleep with neighbors on each side of you being noisy. The bed in the first room was in need of replacement and had a nice "sink hole" in the middle. The room we were switched to was quiet and the bed was great. Only other comment is that housekeeping was inconsistent in that we had to request hand towels one evening after none were left. We also had to request toilet paper on another night when no additional tissue was left by housekeeping during routine cleaning. Probably would look to stay somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Positive experience”
Reviews.Author: niemand
Reviews.Content: We stayed a the Red Lion while playing in abridge tournament in the convention center. The location was perfect, about a 3 or 4 block walk in one direction to the convention center, in the other to the famous Pike Place market. Front desk staff and restaurant staff were pleasant and efficient, and when I mentioned that the toilet was not flushing properly, they made the repairs within a few hours. I must agree with the criticism about the thin walls -- the TV from next door, and the footsteps of children running or people talking in the hallway were all quite annoying. But overall and considering the price, I would gladly return.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place, but concave bed and thin walls”
Reviews.Author: Thaddeus E
Reviews.Content: We stayed in what Red Lion called an "Executive Suite". It had a separate bedroom (with a closing door and its own big TV), plus a large living area with TV, chairs, and sofa. Very nice water view in this 18th floor room. Pros: Very friendly and efficient staff. We brought our 12-month-old baby with us, and they worked hard to make sure we had everything we needed or wanted. Room was very clean. Good food in the breakfast buffet. Good location for the downtown touristy stuff, easy walk to Pike Place. Secure parking was included. Cons: The bed was horrible: it was extremely concave, like trying to sleep in a cereal bowl. We had to line the center of the bed with pillows so that we would not be crammed together by the extreme center-ward tilt of the bed's surface. We had all of our stuff unpacked and a tired baby to soothe when we noticed how bad the bed was, so we decided that we would not complain. We didn't want to pack up again in order to move to another room, plus we specifically needed the closing bedroom this unit featured so our baby would nap peacefully. Also, we could very clearly hear our neighbors on each side. On one side, our living room connected to another unit via a locked door that was not soundproof at all. We had to carefully position our baby's crib near the bathroom of our unit so that we could leave the fan on in order to cover up the sound of our neighbors arguing with each other. Not ideal for a sleepy baby. In addition, while in our bedroom we could hear the other neighbors AS IF THEY WERE IN THE SAME ROOM WITH US. Overall, a nice place, but by the end of our "relaxing" vacation, our whole family was cranky and sleep-deprived due to the terrible bed and the sounds we could always hear through the walls.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
Reviews.Title: “Make sure you get a receipt for cash deposits”
Reviews.Author: Vic S
Reviews.Content: We just got bilked of $200 because the front desk clerk at the Red Lion Hotel on Fifth Avenue, Seattle failed to give us a receipt for a cash deposit. Never again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value in great location”
Reviews.Author: minervaFife_Scotland
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in early November; attending a conference [at another more expensive hotel!] & general sightseeing. Location excellent; room very good; a great simple classic modern European feel. Bed fabulous; housekeeping discreet & very polite. Our room was missing a refrigerator; we did eventually get it after 3 days & querying one! The concierge, Lalla {?} was terrific; friendly, most helpful and knowledgeable; she actually makes the hotel stand out. Breakfast good value and staff very attentive.We didn't have to park a car, but I think the expene of doing that would have put us off staying there; we arrived via the light rail from the airport; an easy few minutes walk, even at midnight! All in akk, excellent; we even joined the Red Lion Club.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good rooms. But the pillows..”
Reviews.Author: Weekendtraveller_10
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our single-night stay at this hotel as a family of three. Our room was nice, street view, on 19th floor. We could check-in early. The only issue was that the pillows smelled like someone had already slept on them. Well, we were tired and did not care to call the housekeeping and deal with it. But, otherwise I would have given this hotel 5 out of 5. Nothing luxurious, but we were not looking for luxury. A very convenient location, 5 minutes walk to Pike Place market is good enough.

Reviews.Title: “I like it”
Reviews.Author: Monilad
Reviews.Content: Booked two rooms for a girls weekend. I feel very pleased with our choice of hotels. Location, Location, Location is great. Two blocks from shopping and a few blocks from the pike place market. Many places to eat and drink right around us. Never needed to use the car. Parking a little stiff at 30 plus tax a night. Rooms very nice, clean and comfortable. Beds great and bathroom was normal size. front desk staff were very helpful. If I am looking for a girls weekend or family weekend again in Seattle this would be the place to go! (no connecting rooms)

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good rooms”
Reviews.Author: emily1535
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just 2 blocks away from the westlake station, which is the station of the light rail (only $2.75) from the airport. So, it is easy to get to the hotel from the airport. Also, the hotel is just at the center of downtown, which means it is just the neighbor of banana republic, loft, ross, American eagle. Also it only takes 5 mins to walk to pike public market or public library. My room is a double queen-size beds room, and it is large. It has a desk, a chair, and a single sofa in the room. The room is clean, and the stuffs looks new. Also, it is quiet. My room is at the 12th level. And I seldom hear any noise there, neither from the street nor the next rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Red Lion on Fifth Avenue Seattle -”
Reviews.Author: Pawan_Hosatti
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Red Lion for a week during a Business visit to Seattle. Rooms are neat and clean. Staff is always welcoming. The Restuarent on the 5th floor is awesome. Nice Food. Beds are soft and cozy. Bar at the Ground is a good place to spend the evening. Location is spot on. Facilities provided like Wifi and local calls (Free) is a huge plus. My colleagues stayed in few other hotels and they had to pay for local calls. I like it and will always choose the same if I'm in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Brittany W
Reviews.Content: I booked a room recently for a bachelorette party and was impressed with our room and incredible view! The double queen room was spacious, clean and well equipted with the extras that are usually associated with much more expensive hotels. The beds were even cozy and soft. We had robes and ipod player and top notch toiletries. They were booked solid and the staff was very friendly and accomodating even with the large crowd waiting to check in when we arrived. (they were all football fans in town for a local rival game). I would recommend this place for anyone needing a comfy nights stay downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place - Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Dennis W
Reviews.Content: We visit Seattle every 3 or 4 months and each time we return to the Red Lion Hotel on 5th Avenue. Their service is very good. Join their frequent visitor club and every few visits, stay for free. The staff have always been very welcoming. The rooms are updated. The view of Puget Sound and the ferry boats coming in and out is a really nice view from the window. Recommend you get a room (like any hotel) away from the elevator. It can get noisy with people coming in and out. It is located right in downtown Seattle, so the shopping, dining is a 5 minute walk. We don't use the restaurant in the hotel as it is a bit pricey and there are so many other places to eat. They have a great exercise facility where you can treadmill and look out over the city.

Reviews.Title: “We love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: HarpGirl
Reviews.Content: We needed early check in, no problem! It took us all of 3 minutes to check in. Our room is good sized, the beds are really comfy. The complementary wireless internet is excellent. So far, we haven't found anything not to like and the location is sooo close to everything. It's especially good if you're going to the 5th Ave for a show.

Reviews.Title: “I'll definitely stay here again!!!”
Reviews.Author: Liz S
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here for two nights (including my 5-1/2 year old granddaughter). The staff was great and I can't say enough about the knowledge of their concierge, Lolly! All we had to do was tell her what we were in the mood for and she had recommendations, directions and prices for what we chose. She was great since we were there to enjoy the beautiful city of Seattle! Excellent location, walking distance to some cool restaurants and Pike Place and Starbucks every two doors was a big plus....but it's probably like that everywhere in Seattle! I will definitely stay at the Red Lion on 5th Avenue next time I visit.....and there will be a next time!

Reviews.Title: “Close to everything.”
Reviews.Author: tricia939
Reviews.Content: The Red lion is a very nice hotel, comfortable beds and reasonable rates. Pikes Market Place, Seattle Aquarium, downtown stores are all within walking distance. The only negative thing I can comment on, is the lack of extra chairs in the room, a desk chair only. The Elephant and Castle Pub is on the property and the food is good. The Benihana, a favourite of ours is also close by.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: izzyd121
Reviews.Content: My review of the Red Lion will probably be biased because we got upgraded to a monster suite. Considering that we booked and paid for a standard room, we got an amazing bargain by getting a one bedroom-suite with a view of the water and of Pike Place. The room had a wet-bar and a sink, along with a mini-fridge and 2 complimentary water bottles. The bathroom was standard. My friends stayed in a separate room, which was a standard king, and she complained how small their bathroom was. I guess for our suite, it was a larger bathroom, because I didn’t have any problems with its size. We had trouble with the air-conditioning, which someone took care of immediately. The staff said that it was because the AC unit in the hotel is old, but they will probably update it soon. We were on the 18th floor, and it was quiet. No noise disturbances. The rooms are clean. The concierge was very friendly and helpful. The location is extremely convenient. We were only a short walk away from Pike Place, and a block away from the monorail that takes you to the Space Needle.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in convenient location”
Reviews.Author: smokey78
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for five nights and enjoyed the stay. The room was very spacious and comfortable. The hotel staff were all friendly and helpful...especially appreciated the help from the concierge! Also, the hotel was in a great central location. Would definitely recommend this hotel and stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Not much to be excited about”
Reviews.Author: thomqui
Reviews.Content: positive: the concierge was terrific. good suggestions for places to eat in vicinity and things to see. always had time for a chat. good downtown location, easy to walk to interesting places and shopping negative: parking area not clearly marked as to where handicapped parking is. 2 night trip, the first night no heat in the room and we were too tired to move. by the next morning we had enough so moved, but temperature wasn't constant. staff were good at helping us move. took view room, but view is too chopped up for our tastes

Reviews.Title: “Great location, large parties beware”
Reviews.Author: Nikki R
Reviews.Content: My best friend reserved a block of rooms here for her entire family and bridal party in August. While the staff was very accommodating with the changing of the number of rooms reserved - their policy on unbooked rooms was pretty sketchy. The agreement was that the bride had to pay a percentage of the un-booked blocked rooms to cover the losses incurred by the hotel, but the night of the wedding we had 3 guests from our party turned away and then the bride's mother was told that not all rooms were booked. Strange? That, and the 'discounted' booking rate was $280 a night, plus $39 a night for parking. Yikes! We had also given the front desk around 60 gift bags to give to the guests who checked into our blocked rooms - only one couple confirmed receiving a gift bag. Not entirely sure what happened to the rest of them. The room that was booked for the bride and myself the night before the wedding was not much larger than a closet, however, the suite her and the groom were given for the night of the wedding was actually very nice. Not sure what the deal is with the see-through bathroom doors though - awkward! Other than all of that, this hotel really was in a great location. Right on 5th Avenue with plenty of coffee shops around and within walking distance of Pike's Place Market. The hotel bar/restaurant Elephant and Castle was a pretty good place to hang out also. The restaurant upstairs was also great for breakfast. I have to give a shout out to the bartender there - the bar was not yet open because it was their 'continental'-style breakfast going on, but we had all partied so hard after the wedding the night before I NEEDED a bloody mary - he opened the bar for me and made all of us the best bloody mary's. Overall, I would recommend this hotel if you are looking for convenience to get out and see the sights. Definitely not for people on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: linkjess
Reviews.Content: We booked on expedia and got the room for less than half the normal price, so it was hard not to be happy with our stay. The location is great and our room was surprisingly large with a comfortable king bed. We even had the slimmest of sound views peaking between the buildings. Parking is outrageous, but that's downtown Seattle, and to be fair they let us stay an extra hour without charging us.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely reccomend this place!!”
Reviews.Author: massdb
Reviews.Content: upon checking in to the red lion i assumed i was in the wrong hotel because just from the lobby it looked amazing. i had booked the red lion after a camping trip in canada and wanted a comfy bed for the last few nights of my stay in seattle, the beds were certainly comfy and huge, ive never slept in a bed that big before. staff were really friendly and helpful, room was very clean, was very impressed with the huge flatscreen tv in my room. would definitely stay here again if i go back to seattle, and cant recommend this place enough!!

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: Staro311
Reviews.Content: Clean room, good location-easy walk to Pike's Market and waterfront. Airport close. Computers free but slow Seedy street behind hotel- don't walk at night Refrigerator in room Loved the bath decor

Reviews.Title: “An excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: Richard F
Reviews.Content: Prior to a recent trip to Seattle, I compared about twelve different downtown hotels using several criteria. These criteria included comments and ratings from other travelers, room inclusions, hotel location, and cost. Based on this comparison, I chose the Red Lion for a brief getaway. It was an excellent choice. My requests prior to arrival were honored as well as a very prompt response for an additional bag stand upon arrival. I was permitted to leave bags at the hotel during a short interval between our arrival in Seattle and our deprature for Vistoria. Contrary to other comments, I noted no problem with noise in the room from either other rooms or the hallway. The location is outstanding; only a block and a half from the SeaTac light rail terminal and a very walkable four block from Pike Market. The attractive pub beneath the hoitel, Elephant and Caslte, was very convenient for evening dining. The only negative, and I told the desk clerk upon depature, was the bathroom lighting. Design-wis it is very attractive, but the perimeter lights around the mirror shine directly into ones eyes when using the mirror which causes ones pupils to contract making it a little difficult to see well.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and lovely rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Barbaradee1959
Reviews.Content: Loved the clean rooms, friendly front desk, and location. We walked to the lightrail, three blocks from the hotel to get to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Emerald Setting”
Reviews.Author: airborne2201
Reviews.Content: The Red Lion provides great offers to military and government employees. Their clean rooms and friendly staff made my stay there comfortable and the with the parking garage right under the hotel it makes it easy to get in and out to see other parts of Seattle. I did not go to the restaurant that the hotel had but there are plenty of great places to eat right around the area. I can't wait to schedule my next visit, great location right downtown.

Reviews.Title: “3 PM Check-in a Joke”
Reviews.Author: JulieMI54
Reviews.Content: I booked my room in early July, requesting an early check-in. We arrived at 12 noon; told to place bags with Bell Captain and return at 3; the normal time. We got back at 2pm and waited in the lobby for almost 2 hours. We weren't the only ones waiting, and found out other guests had similar problems; one person remarked the staff was arrogant. Finally given a room at 3:45pm; 15 minutes before we were to be picked up for another event. Each time we asked if the room was ready (room number given to us right away), we were told the same excuse; the hotel was full and housekeeping was trying to catch up. If you have guests waiting in the lobby, wouldn't you try and get those rooms done first? Around 3:30 pm, from our vantage point in the lobby, we heard other guests being told to wait; as the rooms weren't ready yet. One lucky person walked right up to the desk with her luggage and as given a room right away. She hadn't been waiting at all, so some rooms were getting cleaned; just not for those waiting over 2 hours. As the week wore on, we noticed this happened every day; luggage overflowing at the Bell Captain's desk from guests not being to check in. Nothing was given to us or others for the inconvenience. If you can't honor your guests early check-in/arrival, take the option off your web site/reservation. But its also a major problem if check-in is at 3 pm and you can't even honor that time. Does mean we don't have to check out until 2 pm? Having gotten up at 4:30 am (1:30 am Seattle time) and traveling all day, siting in a lobby is the last thing anyone wants to endure. The location was great and the room was really nice; price wasn't that good. Next time we will look for another hotel or rent a house. The hotel restaurant food was fair; only meal we ate there was breakfast and not that special. Our waiter was very nice and friendly, but we didn't return for additional meals.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: jcags
Reviews.Content: Had no double rooms when we arrived even though we booked more than 6 months in advance! They gave us a cot for one night. AC coming in under the door from the hall froze us. Move us to a doubled room the next day. This room had no working AC. We couldn't win at this place. Location good and they were very good about discounting the price for our troubles.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! Location, location , location!”
Reviews.Author: rdhfn
Reviews.Content: We have found this Red Lion to be a hidden gem in downtown Seattle. It is surrounded by good restaurants and convenient to the 5th Avenue Theater. Good price and nice rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great service!”
Reviews.Author: R K
Reviews.Content: I'm a seasoned traveler and am not really one to write reviews but this hotel is exceptional. I've stayed here before and always had great service. The staff is always friendly, especially their concierge and bellman. This time, I got upgraded to a suite and loved that they had Bulgari bath products. Their personal touch is remarkable. Kudos to the staff for making me feel at home.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: gonealot
Reviews.Content: Would highly recommend this hotel. The location outstanding as it is in walking distance to shopping and attractions. Just blocks to Pike Market. The room was large, extremely clean, and well appointed.

Reviews.Title: “Blue Jays in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Gateway1_10
Reviews.Content: Went down to Seattle to watch the Blue Jays plan and stayed at the Red Lion Hotel again. Checking in was a real challenge with a large turnover of hotel guests all arriving at the same time. Our booking had been a last minute decision so was unable to book a King Size room. There was a significant waiting period but when the lady came to inform us that Housekeeping had confirmed the room was now ready, she also had been able to find us a "King Size" which was a pleasant surprise! As usual, it is the people that make the experience and the staff at the Red Lion Hotel have demonstrated that again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: SMH19
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 stayed in two rooms at the Red Lion in August 2011. The rooms were well sized and the staff got us on the same floor, which I appreciated. The location is fantastic. We did rent a car and drive out to the Museum of Flight, but everything else we walked to or took the monorail (Space Needle). I would definitely recommend the hotel to others. Our package included breakfast, which was a buffet with efficient beverage service. Perfect for families.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for all the sights”
Reviews.Author: dhtlancashire
Reviews.Content: We had a very good short stay before going on a cruise. The room was clean, and very comfortable. Exrtemely comfortable bed. Ate at the hotel for dinner and breakfast with quick and attentive service. Food was also good. Front desk were very helpful. Can recommend for short breaks.

Reviews.Title: “Great location downtown.”
Reviews.Author: sunless_n_seattle
Reviews.Content: The rooms in this hotel are on parr with other 4-stars in area. Lobby not as opulent but the Terrace Garden Restaurant and Bar are definately worth a visit. 19th floor rooms don't offer much of an eastern view but looked to be resently renovated.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location near everything”
Reviews.Author: vapour-cabbie
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in the heart of downtown. The hotel was clean and everyone was friendly and helpful. The breakfast was simple and okay, nothing fancy. The Location was the best and a selling point for staying there. Easy to get around. Taxis were fast and the price was very resonable. The bakery across the street is well worth the long lines. Breakfast and lunch were worth the wait. Would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Will be my GoTo in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: mzungu f
Reviews.Content: Good Value, Great Location. Underground parking which can be included in rate. Breakfast included in rate was good, and the outdoor deck is a plus when the weather is decent, especially for a downtown hotel. a couple options within the hotel for dinner/drinks, and location is right in the heart of downtown shopping and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing To Write Home About”
Reviews.Author: kmcbod5
Reviews.Content: Desk staff, bellman, and concierge were all very kind and helpful but the hotel itself is boring. There is absolutely nothing special about this hotel other than it is convienently located in the center of downtown. The rooms are small, have no full length mirrors, and our room did not get cleaned two out of the four days we were there. The restaurant with terrace seating is highly overpriced and the food is poor. On the up side, the pub attached, Elephant & Castle, is a fun place to drink, has good sandwiches and lots of patio seating and the fitness center is pretty good for a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly placed to get to know Seattle city”
Reviews.Author: Suzywongtraveller
Reviews.Content: Excellent position for visiting Seattle and very friendly hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: Arbet
Reviews.Content: Great location, attentive service. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with Service Blunders”
Reviews.Author: redr8r
Reviews.Content: Until the hotel improves their transportation agreement for their cruise departure package, don't bother. Just book their best rate and arrange your own transportation to the pier. Don't expect early check-in when arriving in Seattle - rooms weren't ready even at the posted check-in time of 3 p.m. Hotel location is good - lots of great shopping and dining within a few blocks.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Clean and Comfortable Rooms”
Reviews.Author: JeanSaintLouisMO
Reviews.Content: We knew we had booked in a great location, but were pleasantly surprised by the quality of the room. Recently redecorated and sparkling clean, we had a view of Puget Sound and Pike Place from our window. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Accomodations and Location”
Reviews.Author: drajdiva
Reviews.Content: I used this hotel as my home base during a week of business travel across Washington state and it made the exhausting trip a pleasure. The king-bed room was spacious, clean, and well appointed (including a robe in closet though I never use them). I was also surprised to find a mini-fridge. Check-in was quick and the bellman and concierge were very helpful with directions and recommendations. Just out the door are loads of restaurants, bars, and shops. The hotel is located close within a few blocks of the transit station where you can catch the AirLink train to Sea/Tac airport, the monoail to the Space Needle, and Pike Steet market. The only possible negative is the lack of a business center thought the hotel has free wi-fi that was generally reliable. I didn't eat in the hotel restaurant given the large number nearby dining options (breakfast is much cheaper outside the hotel). Note: The AAA rate provides a noticeable discount.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: southgeorgiaporch
Reviews.Content: I was a little concerned about staying here after some of the reviews but I loved it and would reccomend it to anyone. I selected a room "with view" and it was worth it, the view was great. It was in an excellent location, just blocks from the Market, shopping, and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Downtown Hotel with Great Customer Service Pre-Cruise”
Reviews.Author: BobKats
Reviews.Content: We needed a downtown hotel pre-cruise and the Red Lion on Fifth turned out to be a great start to a fantastic trip. The front desk staff was very helpful and the process was efficient. The rooms are very nice and the beds are heavenly. We did not partake of the restaurants on property, but did have drinks at the attached Elephant & Castle and a wonderful breakfast at a nice bakery a block away on Fifth the next morning. The concierge arranged a taxi/van to deliver us to the cruise ship which was very helpful. You are within walking distance of Pike Place Market and other waterfront restaurants and sights. I do recommend Cutters on the Bay, which also has a free shuttle for patrons back to the hotel...inquire when you arrive. Enjoy Seattle, a very friendly and safe downtown.

Reviews.Title: “They saved the day!”
Reviews.Author: vtles
Reviews.Content: We were unceremoniously sent here from the Mayflower Park hotel after a booking error (even though we booked 11 months in advance!). The staff at the Red Lion was lovely and took great care of us. Big rooms. Very clean. Pretty lobby with cucumber-strawberry water (a big hit with our daughter). Excellent location right near the monorail and an easy walk to pike's place. All good except it did get a little stuffy in our room since we couldn't control the heat/cooling. Not oppressive though.

Reviews.Title: “At the nexus of downtown...”
Reviews.Author: Lael_Lael
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, when you're at the nexus of downtown you're kind of between buildings with no view. Our room overlooked an odd cement courtyard. Other than that, though, the Red Lion exceeded my expectations on all levels. The service is exemplary and the staff really went the extra mile to make sure our stay was worry free. They let us check in an entire cart of luggage for what ended up being 2 days after we checked out and were extremely gracious in all interactions. Check in couldn't have been simpler. The restaurant stops serving food rather early, I want to say midnight. The ceilings in the guest rooms are unusually high which makes the hotel feel very spacious and classy. The beds are dreamily comfortable, although the walls are not entirely sound proof and we were woken by the room at the head of our bed several times. They offer an excellent breakfast buffet (hot food, coffee, etc.) for $5 per person, which is a killer deal. Another cool thing about the Red Lion is that it is immediately next to the "diamond building", the center of the Seattle jewelry industry.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location - nicer than we expected”
Reviews.Author: divealive
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect location for those who like a short walk to the market, excellent shopping and reasonably priced yummy food. The service at the Red Lion was friendly, efficient and knowledgeable. We had a small fridge and microwave in the room - believe me, we know of some questionable Red Lions, and were skeptical, but we were pleasantly surprised by this one. We had bathrobes in the closet, cucumber and strawberry water in the lobby - and the ambience was cozy and comfortable. We shopped at Nordstrom (including the Rack), Macy's - did the Underground Tour, had some nice Asian Food at PF Chang's and Benihana's. And ALL of this we did on our feet. Of course, this is quite an accomplishment given the sensitive backs and necks involved. One exceptional place for a meal was Specialty's Deli on the corner across from the hotel. They had amazing homemade breakfasts and lunches at low prices. Their Manhattan Clam Chowder and MSG free pastrami sandwiches were to die for - as well as their breakfast sandwiches on Ciabatta. Only words of advice "GET THERE EARLY" - they also have healthy oatmeal, fruit salad and baked goods. We'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: RunningNana
Reviews.Content: Used TA reviews to find this hotel. In town for the marathon in June and booked this for a 3 night stay. Never had been to Seattle so did not know where to start. Called ahead to find out if I needed a car for downtown "stuff" a very helpful gentleman told me no and he was right. The light link station is an easy 2 block walk. All the tourist attractions are either walkable or there is public transit very near. Third ave is 2 blocks away and you are able to catch busses for multiple routes there. The room was very comfortable, the concierge service helpful. would stay here again. Remember to buy some beautiful flowers at Pikes Market for your room on the first day and ask Housekeeping for a vase to use.

Reviews.Title: “OK stay, but probably overpriced”
Reviews.Author: almsmall
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here, but after staying at the Silver Cloud on Lake Union our last night in town, we realized how much we overspent. When we checked in the sheets on at least one bed were dirty, which was pretty gross. Housekeeping came and changed them but I'm not sure they saw that there was a problem. Otherwise, the location can't be beat. Walkable to everything and public transportation is close and cheap for everything else.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Precruise Stay”
Reviews.Author: jkrislc
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night prior to a cruise. Excellent location. Pike Market is within walking distance as are several restaurants. In addition, there is a grocery store and a Walgreens within a couple of blocks for any precruise necessities. Rooms were nice and modern. However, know that the bathrooms have frosted glass doors which don't offer a lot a privacy. This wasn't a problem for us, but could be if you were sharing a room with a nonfamily member. Our rate included a breakfast buffet, parking and internet. While I wouldn't have paid for the breakfast buffet, the quality was very good. Beyond a couple of egg dishes, the buffet was largely continental with the addition of an automated pancake maker. Juice, coffee, and milk was also readily available. For the price we paid and because of the location, I wouldn't hesitate staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Will never ever stay in a Red Lion Property again”
Reviews.Author: sacratomato2010
Reviews.Content: So, we were in Seattle for a few days and staying in three different hotels from an auction prize that I had purchased for hundreds of dollars. After staying at the Red Lion Hotel, we remembered that it was the stay that included a breakfast which was listed on the certificate we turned in at check-in. We were never told how to redeem our breakfast when we checked in and we had completely forgot about it during our stay there. So, we called about using it since we were still in town but now at our third hotel. We spoke to the front desk and to the manager on duty, which was a Director of Engineering, and were told "No" and "No". No effort was made to work with us in any way, since this is something we had actually bought and paid good money for. So much for custom service and hospitality. We usually have a bowl of oatmeal and some waffles with fruit and coffee in the morning, so they saved themselves a few bucks. However, I will never go to a Red Lion Hotel again out of principle.

Reviews.Title: “Location priced evidently”
Reviews.Author: RenfieldPonsford
Reviews.Content: Absolutely great location, close to the market on Pike and great shopping all within blocks of the hotel. Room was small but very clean with a tremendous view of the water. Absolutely ordinary restaurant/bar and a very dated business centre but the staff were pleasant and helpful. A nice hotel (but not spectacular) but pretty pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Stayed several times and would again.”
Reviews.Author: MikeCalgaryAB
Reviews.Content: I love everything about this hotel. Stayed several times. Great location. Nice staff. Big rooms. Great views. Not the cheapest in town and parking is a little pricey, but so central. Clean. Excellent with pets. They give you a doggie bag for your dogs with treats and the pet rooms are very well deep cleaned. Definately staying next time I go. Only rated value as 4 as it's relative. But great staff, cleaners and designers don't come cheap at the end of the day, so not a bargain but reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in downtown Seattle”
Reviews.Author: hoppersh
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Red Lion hotel for one night, July 16, before our Alaskan cruise. We chose this hotel based on its central location downtown. It’s about 4 blocks from Pike Place Market, 2 blocks from the monorail station, and about 10 blocks from Seattle Center and the Space Needle. There were also plenty of dining and shopping choices surrounding. Our room was on the 8th floor and had a view of the building across the street. My parents’ room was on the 11th floor and had a great view of the waterfront. The view is evidently luck-of-the-draw because we had booked the same rooms. Both rooms were well-furnished and clean. The only thing lacking was a safe in the rooms--not a big deal for a one-night stay, but for a longer stay could be a problem for some travelers. A free coffee station is located in the lobby in the mornings. Internet service was free as well and had a good connection speed in our room. Check-out time was 12pm, perfect for our cruise ship departure. The bellman can also store luggage for guests after check-out time if needed. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to fellow cruisers in Seattle. While the price was high due to the time of year, it was still reasonable compared to other hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & Value”
Reviews.Author: Ossitraveller
Reviews.Content: Arrived at airport & used the cheap & efficient light rail to 'Westlake' station. A short stroll from there with our luggage to the hotel. Check in was efficient & we had a great room on a high floor with views over Puget Sound. Used the AAA rate (they honoured the Australian equivalent) with breakfast for $179.95 per night plus tax. Room was spacious, quiet and clean. Location was excellent, Pike Place market within a couple of blocks (could see it from our room). Produce and food here was great. Breakfast we only did once-lousy coffee and nothing to write home about. Starbucks across the road another coffee/ deli on the opposite corner nearby insured we got our caffeine fix. Took ferry to Bainbridge Island, did tours with Northwest Tours (highly recommended) to Boeing Factory and day tour of Seattle. Would stay again if ever in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and close to everything.”
Reviews.Author: Tululahh
Reviews.Content: Nice clean hotel close to everything we wanted. Down the street from Pikes. Room was nice with a GREAT view. 2 downsides Parking is over 30.00 a night and no pool. But if your going on a cruise park at the cruise terminal for 20.00 a night and just get a ride back or walk. It's not that far. We walked all over Seattle and had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Stay in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: tryto82
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a four-night stay at this hotel. Really enjoyed my stay, from the time I checked in, to the time I checked out. Friendly front desk staff, seemed efficient and professional. Had a great room, with a wonderful view on the 19th floor. Room appeared very clean, with very generous amenities. A few noteworthy observations; no room safe, no wet bar, very few television channels. If you have valuables, you must go to the front desk to secure them. Breakfast was not included in my room price, however I did decide to check it out. The daily breakfast buffet was reasonable, with fair service and a very general menu selection. If you just want coffee, there are numerous coffee shops within walking distance, actually directly across the street there is a Starbucks. The hotel location is probably the best feature, abundant shopping, restaurants, and of course Pike Place Market is about a ten-minute walk away. I did not rent a car on this trip, but I really did not need one. I utilized the concierge during my stay. He was also very helpful in obtaining information on transportation needs, ferry schedules, tour information, and taxis when needed. Lastly, I utilized the free Wi-Fi, worked great.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: pkbspencer
Reviews.Content: This hotel is location on 5th ave in a prime location - perfect walking distance to the Pike Market Place and the shops. Large comfortable rooms and foc internet a bonus. The hotel staff aren't great - we checked in at 10pm and were told that our room was not ready even though we could have checked in hours ago so even though it started off bad, once we got our room all was good. Would definately stay there again when next in Seattle

Reviews.Title: “Great location , terrible cleanliness”
Reviews.Author: twerocks
Reviews.Content: Location was perfect, close to pike market and other shopping. Parking was 30 a day with in out privileges and was very handy. Our 2 yr old was playing on the floor in our room and picked up what turned out to be a piece of dry dog poop. This was absolutely disgusting and management didn't really seem to care and only offered to have someone come up and clean it up. We will not be returning to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Clean. Friendly.”
Reviews.Author: bereal2day
Reviews.Content: Great location in downtown. Walking access to almost anywhere. Friendly staff. Clean rooms. A bit dated interior ... but definitely this decade. Parking is $30/night and under the hotel. Some people get a package with parking and breakfast. we didn't ... but we booked on hot wire and got a pretty good rate.

Reviews.Title: “No Heating/Cooling on Demand”
Reviews.Author: Walloughby57
Reviews.Content: Great location, nicely decorated rooms, clean and comfortable, with a very friendly and accommodating staff. Our only complaint which left us with three restless and uncomfortable nights was that the hotel has and old style two-pipe heating/cooling system, meaning that the temperature in your room is largely a function of the water temperature that us being circulated through the system's central chiller. Since we like our bedroom at home around 63 to get a good night's sleep, it was possible to get the room that cool, and of course, you can't open a window. I must say that the hotel really tried hard to address our concerns by sending two maintenance guys to open the damper (a device that controls air flow into the room), and sent us a fan, which gave us a little relief. But if you want the modern convenience of heating or cooling on demand, this hotel isn't for you. That's a shame, really, because they're hitting on all cylinders otherwise. We got a terrific rate, the hotel is nice and the staff is caring and well trained (except for a grumpy night auditor who treated my query about an open Starbucks as if I were an interruption to whatever it is that night auditors do).

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: MCum75
Reviews.Content: My husband was there for a conference and I tagged along. The hotel was good - great location, decent price, clean room, good workout room and comfortable beds. However, the room was dark and has inadequate lighting.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: KanataCalgary
Reviews.Content: We were able to check in early to the Red Lion 5th Avenue. Erin at the front desk recommended a few local restaurants like The Pink Door that were outstanding. When in Seattle you will see an abundance of fresh cut cheap flowers and our conceirge was more than happy to set us up with a lovely vase so we could enjoy the flowers in our room. Everyone was so friendly, the rooms are quite large and the fridge in the room was nice to have to that we could store some fresh market produce. Parking is steep ($30 plus taxes) but it's the same at home in Calgary so we understood. Sometimes Red Lion offers packages that include parking. The breakfast buffet was extensive and cost $14.95 per person. The location is AWESOME! We walked EVERYWHERE! Bring runners as Seattle is hillier than expected and it's a long way down to the waterfront. the market is mere blocks away as is the free bus system. You can even walk to QWest and Safeco stadiums or jump on the bus for a stop or two to get there. All in all we were really impressed with the smiles, cleanliness and the customer service. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, dark rooms”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth28970
Reviews.Content: The hotel was fine - decent price, great location, clean rooms, and comfortable beds. But the rooms are dark with a brown and tan color scheme and inadequate lighting. I was there for a conference and had to ask for an extra lamp in order to get my work done. That still didn't make the room an adequate work-place in terms of lighting.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Therese59
Reviews.Content: We had the friendliest welcome. Upgraded our room to a waterfront room and had the best we could ever get. Stayed on floor 16 in a large room and looked directly down to Pike Place Market and the waterfront. Easy walk to all shops, Pioneer Square and everything a tourist likes. We recomend this hotel to everybody.

Reviews.Title: “lovely rooms, great service”
Reviews.Author: kashl
Reviews.Content: this is one of the best places we stayed on our vacation, wonderfull clean rooms, very friendly service. highly reccomend!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Hope1215
Reviews.Content: Red Lion was chosen based on trip advisor reviews, as I had not honestly ever heard of this chain before. Location was perfect for walking to all major sights/shopping, including the fact that just literally within a few minute walk is the famous Seattle open market. Staff was helpful and gave good restaurant suggestions as well. Room sizes adequate with nice amenities. Parking was included in our room package and this made the hotel even more convenient. I would recommend this hotel for a downtown Seattle experience.

Reviews.Title: “There are better options...trust me”
Reviews.Author: osutravel
Reviews.Content: 1) no hot water in bathroom sink 2) Trash was not emptied out of room 3) Hotel front desk staff was incompetant 4) Could not mail business letters from the hotel ( no stamps at front desk!) 5) Tired looking elevators 6) overpriced There are MUCH better hotels and locations in Seattle. Explore before you sign up to stay here....

Reviews.Title: “So So hotel”
Reviews.Author: firebc6111
Reviews.Content: Great location downtown but the hotel is just OK. Our room's AC had a problem. Asked the front desk three times for maintenance and never saw or heard from any maintenance person. Parking in their lot is $30/day...ouch!

Reviews.Title: “The room that wasn't there"”
Reviews.Author: Saruman1
Reviews.Content: Actually, we DIDN'T stay, although we had booked back in November of last year, for five people , for a night before our cruise. Two other family members also booked there to meet us, and I suggested this hotel to others on the cruise on a message board. However, there was also a U2 Concert and a Mariners game that night, and somehow....no real explanation given...somehow there was someone "still there" in one of our rooms and there was no other room available. The front desk was sorry, they gave me a reservation half a year in advance but now there wasn't one. To their credit, however, they offered to put all five of us (to keep us together) in "a comparable hotel" at their expense, and would pay for the two cabs it would take to get us over there. (Across town, due to scarcity of rooms downtown!) The other hotel was the University Inn, not quite as upscale as Red Lion, and in the UW district instead of downtown, but it was clean and comfortable and with a friendly staff. Because we had also booked a private shuttle to get us to the pier the next day, Red Lion cabbed us back the next morning (at their expense) and fed us breakfast with the others in our family who had successfully checked in. While the hassle and inconvenience of schlepping our luggage twice more than we'd planned on was annoying,and the time factor limited our ability to see much of downtown Seattle, we did save some money on the deal and feel the Red Lion did its best to rectify what was, ultimately, their error. I doubt that I'll be giving Red Lion another chance in the future, (we come annually to Seattle, often with groups of 2-4 others), but bear them no ill will...assuming room charges for the Red Lion DON'T show up on my credit card bill next month! The two family members who got a room thought it was nice place to stay, and we certainly enjoyed their restaurant. Live and Learn.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel other than the lighting issue”
Reviews.Author: 1037wolf
Reviews.Content: I want to first give you the positive things about this hotel. The staff is very courteous and all employees really give 100% to have you enjoy your stay. The rooms are clean, the restaurants are enjoyable (especially the lower level pub) and all in all a very good value. Now the negative> The lighting in the hallways, rooms, bathrooms etc. is terrible. I don't understand what would be so hard to update the lighting to make the rooms bright and comfortable. You can hardly see to put on makeup, and forget about reading anything. This is my only complaint and I hope they do something about it because the hotel itself is very very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in a perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Pisendel
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night prior to boarding a cruise to Alaska. Absolutely flawless experience - nice room, good rate, great location within easy walking distance of the waterfront, Pike st Market, restaurants etc. We only had a 5 minute taxi ride to the pier for boarding the cruise ship, and if you didn't have much luggage would have been pretty easy to walk to the ship! Staff were very helpful, and the room was very clean and modern. We'll definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown location, too many flaws for price”
Reviews.Author: Jenniferigor
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night with a friend in a room with two queen beds on the 9th floor. Price was $239 before taxes, which included free parking and free buffet breakfast. It is in an older high rise building. Location was great, as we were going to see a show at the 5th Avenue Theater and it was less than a block away. Also within walking distance to Nordstrom, Westlake Center, etc. We checked in at 4:15pm and had trouble finding a spot to park in the garage. We were also surprised our room wasn't ready. There was a lovely container of ice water with strawberries and cucumbers in the lobby, but there was hardly any water left and with all the people waiting, it ran out. We didn't get to our room until 5pm. Ice was on even floors so I went to the 8th floor only to find the ice machine was out of order. Our room had a peek-a-boo view of Elliott Bay. A few floors higher would have made for a great view. The beds were very comfortable and it was nice to have a refrigerator in the room. However, there was a big wet spot on the carpet where someone had spilled something and the window had a big lipstick stain on it. I had hoped the room would be cleaner. At breakfast the next morning, we had to wait about 15 minutes to be seated and I was not impressed with their buffet. There was an interesting pancake machine, sausage links, bacon, homestyle potatoes, two kinds of scrambled eggs, a few breads and cereals and juice. Most of the time they were out of something, so it didn't seem like there was much to offer. While we got our food, they gave our table away and we had to get another one. We did have a friendly server named Nicole, who brought coffee and we had fun talking with her. At check-out, the room cost $277 once taxes were added. It seemed like a lot to pay for a hotel that needs to get their act together.

Reviews.Title: “great location, value and hotel”
Reviews.Author: Phillips66
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights here and what a great choice. ! The location was just two blocks from the light rail terminal which was just $2.50 from the SEATAC AIRPORT...An easy walk. Right in the middle of downtown, easy walking distance to everything. The room was great...up to date. Above average decor. Great English style pub on the bottom floor...Excellent Restraunt and morning buffet.

Reviews.Title: “SUPERB”
Reviews.Author: uwbooster
Reviews.Content: I had written a review with glowing comments & then discovered I had checked incorrect circles. So Sorry! This hotel was simply wonderful. CLean, well maintained, super friendly and helpful staff. Everything you could want in a reasonable price. Can't say enough good things about our week stay. Hotel dining room was lovely and the is an unaffiliated restaurant on the basement level that is great as well. The location couldn't be better. We didn't rent a car and transportation, as well as walking around, was very convenient to shopping and sightseeing. We will make it a pont to visit this hotel again and recommend it to all.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, good value.”
Reviews.Author: Mom56CA
Reviews.Content: Fly into SEA and take light rail into the city, walk two blocks and you are there. From here we walked, took a bus, rode the monorail and the streetcar to see everything on a three-day trip. The breakfast buffet was very good as was the pub downstairs. Staff was friendly and efficient. Will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “nice little gem”
Reviews.Author: krnwife
Reviews.Content: I went to Seattle for a conference and found this hotel on travelocity. I had never heard of Red Lion before so I wasn't sure what to expect. Some of my friends were staying at the more well known hotel chains so I was a bit nervous however all of my apprehension quickly faded from the moment I stepped in. This hotel was great. It's smaller but the location is perfect. It was very close to the convention center. Our hotel room was very comfy and I absolutely loved the bathroom. Everything was updated. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Over priced, bad service, poor rooms”
Reviews.Author: rcc1910
Reviews.Content: At the risk of sounding like a malcontent, I'm writing this anyway so someone might avoid our recent experience. This is only the second bad review I've given a hotel in years. All hotels have bad days. This hotel can't possibly have any good days given their institutional issues. This is a hotel that has seen better days, I'm guessing. The lighting inside was very poor, especially in the bath. TV channel selection: the worst I've seen in years. Forget HBO, etc.; you can't even get CNN or PBS. Service? How about no newspapers at all, even the local papers, anywhere in the building on weekends. So you go ask the concierge for help on a Saturday? The concierge is gone till Monday. When I got there, there was a convention checking out. One clerk, 30 mins plus wait. Worst of all, or maybe best of all: we moved out after one night--a rare event for us--and cancelled the rest of our reservation, then we got a room for the same price at the Fairmont Olympia, a top of the line property. Same price. It baffles me why anyone would knowingly choose the Red Lion. We did it because my wife was there on a conference, and we decided to stay there afterward. It's too bad because they have a good location, and with some work and a lower price, they could be ok. They seem to be clueless about the deficiences. Or maybe they're not. They are clearly wringing every last dollar out of that property. Return business is not in their game plan. They don't seem to be serious hotel folks. I will not be their guest again. I've rarely stayed at Red Lions. Is the entire chain this way? rcc

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in downtown Seattle”
Reviews.Author: RC_NE
Reviews.Content: I stayed here several years ago and was passing through so I stayed here for two nights. The check in was quick and painless. I was staying in a deluxe king room-1907. The view of the water and the market was great. There was a building in they way for a clear view, but it was still great. The rooms had been updated with lcd televisions, and newer fixtures. My package included breakfast buffet. It was a standard buffet; sausage, bacon, potatoes, scrambled eggs, bagels, toast, and pastries. The real beauty of this hotel is its location. It is right in the heart of the city with lots of eating and shopping within walking distance. The parking is under the hotel and expensive, but that is pretty much standard in downtown hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: LUVtheNW
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Easter weekend in a 20th floor room overlooking the Sound. The view was outstanding. The room was VERY nice. All was very clean and well cared for. We love the location, a block and a half from Westlake Mall. The Elephant & Castle Pub downstairs is one of our favorite happy hour locales in downtown Seattle. The food is good. This place is a little spendy, but we keep going back :) The biggest bonus for us is the Dog Friendly benefit. The pet surcharge is waived for R&R Members AND you get 500 bonus points for bringing your dog!

Reviews.Title: “Great price, nice room, great location, great service, nice restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Bluevanilla
Reviews.Content: We were doing a tour of Washington state and were recommended this hotel from a friend. When we arrived the front counter packaged our parking and room as well as including a breakfast for less money than we had originally booked for. She saved us about $40 right from the start and included a breakfast in that as well. The location was nice and close to everything, the room was clean and updated. The restaurant was very good and the breakfast buffet that was included was great. The service was very good and everyone was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Valentine's Day Weekend!”
Reviews.Author: orionsangel2
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a few times and really love the location. Great property and super friendly desk staff! Clean rooms and really nice hotel. I would recommend this for family or business travel. The "Only" thing about this hotel that's unfortunate is the food - its disgusting! I had poached eggs, toast, bacon and hashbrowns for breakfast. It was swimming in grease. The eggs were still raw. I didn't eat hardly any of it but the toast. They need a new cook! Drinks in the bar - yummy! Appetizers were also fairly good. Parking 35.00 a night (a bit steep when you're paying for a room) otherwise I do like the location once you're there you can pretty much walk all over downtown. Some great places there too! The Purple Wine Bar - AWESOME! LOVE IT!!!!! Overall though - I really look forward to my stays in Seattle at this property :) We had a super fun romantic Valentine's Day weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Downtown Hotel on a Budget”
Reviews.Author: pattyd_16
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is nearly ideal - very easy walk to Pike's Place Market and great restaurants and shopping. I had a spacious room with a comfortable bed and free wifi, which was really all I needed. The staff were very helpful and friendly - at the desk, but also when passing in the halls and elevators. The hotel lounge was comfortable and had a good happy hour, but there's also a nice Irish pub in the basement of the hotel with great beer on tap and decent pub food. All in all, a very pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “great location, excellent front staff”
Reviews.Author: ally5SunshineCoast
Reviews.Content: Arriving with my 80 year mother, I really appreciated the help we received from the guy at the front who arranged everything for us. He helped me with mum to get to our room which was great (really clean and beds to die for) and then helped us in every way. he organized a car to take us to the pier and pick us up and then another car to the airport when we left. Thank goodness because Mum left her bag with her passport in it in the car and we didn't notice till we were to board the plane. Thanks to his help the driver arrived with the bag just before our flight and we were able to depart. I'll never thank you enough ( I.m so sorry I can"t remember your name)

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, great location! But don't bring car!”
Reviews.Author: Huskies04
Reviews.Content: My title says it all. I live near Seattle but due to being part of an event last weekend, needed a place to stay downtown. The hotel itself is average. Nothing fancy inside at all. The room we had was average. Not very big, clean enough, not fancy. The other reviews that mentioned temperature were certainly onto something as the room was usually very warm or cold, no in between. But the location is simply amazing! The heart of downtown Seattle. Lots of great shopping and eating are a short walk away from the hotel, thats for sure. The service by the staff was fine. My biggest complaint is the parking. $30 per night. I know this has become pretty common with hotels these days,but come on! It just isn't right. So for anyone wanting to stay here, I suggest not bringing a car.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Nice Rooms”
Reviews.Author: waiomaogirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two nights in February, Saturday and Sunday and checked on a Monday. Won the Red Lion through Hotwire for $73 a night. I thought it was a great deal. The location is ideal for shopping downtown, Convention Center, and Pike's Place. The hotel was easy to find and check-in was quick and easy. We had our baby with us and requested a crib. It was delivered within 15 minutes. We had a room on the 6th floor, very close to the elevators. But, we didn't really hear the elevators or much noise. We had two queens in our room, a sitting chair, and desk area. There was also a flat screen tv and refrigerator! The bathroom was huge with bath and body works shampoo, conditioner, lotion, and soap. The room was clean and decently sized for our family of 4. The parking is under the hotel in a garage. Upon check-in there was an attendant. On Sunday night around 10pm, the attendant wasn't there. Parking is expensive in downtown. One night costs $30 + taxes, which ended up being $36.60. Also, the garage has a pretty low clearance, 6ft 2 inches.
