Our minivan was able to fit and there are some decent sized parking spots if you are lucky to get one. On Saturday night when we got back from dinner, the parking lot was full and we got one of the last spots. However, on Sunday night, the parking lot was empty. So, it just depends on how busy the hotel is. I would definitely recommend this hotel to others. We enjoyed our stay at the Red Lion. Free wifi was also working and great to have in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent last minute choice!”
Reviews.Author: lemonss
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I went down to Seattle to do some shopping and due to the long line up at the border, decided to just make a night of it. We walked around looking for a hotel to stay for the night and came across the Red Lion on 5th. The hotel is beautiful, you can tell it had been renovated recently. I especially liked the fresh water they have in the lobby, filled with fruit. We asked for available rooms and was able to get a good deal that including parking (till 4PM the next day) and breakfast buffet in their restaurant. The location is superb as it's right in the downtown core. It was very much like being at home (downtown Vancouver). The hotel is walking distance to the Market, Nordstrom Rack, even the Space Needle. That night we walked from the hotel down to Belltown to have dinner at Mama's (excellent Mexican restaurant!). The only thing was that the hotel's walls are paper thin. You can hear your neighbour's talking (if they're louder) or their TV if it's on. You can also hear the traffic in the hallway, but this didn't bother us much. The room we stayed in was very clean and the bed was comfortable. I really wish I could take their pillows home! All round, good hotel for the price we paid. If we decide to stay overnight in Seattle again, we'd definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “perfect location in an remodeld older hotel with dark rooms and no temperature control”
Reviews.Author: trevor-wa
Reviews.Content: we live in seattle and stayed at the red lion for a xmas nite out , theater, dinner, hotel. the red lion is in the perfect location for everything in seattle, it's an older hotel and the rooms have been updated the best they can but they still are dark with no temperature control - but don't let that scare you away as long as it is $100 per nite or less

Reviews.Title: “Best Buy and Location in Downtown Seattle with exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: WA frequent traveller
Reviews.Content: Bought the breakfast and parking package plus a two queen room with a water view and paid less than $150. One block from FIFTH AVE THEATRE; five blocks from SAM, five blocks from Pke Place market. One block from major shopping areas. I called the hotel about 11 am to find out if our room was available for check in. It was. After lunch and the drive from Olympia we arrived and checked in at 2 pm. One disappointment was I ordered room with view of the sound. Since we were only on 9th floor we basically had view of the terrace and office buildings and a peek a boo view of some water between the buildings. Alex at the front desk had taken my phone call, remembered me, and check in was quick and efficient. Had to call the desk because the room was freezing and did not heat up in an hour. Engineer came immediately but said that heat was working and would just take time. He put thermostat at highest setting. We bundled in blankets until time to go to dinner at 5 PM. Returned at 9 PM and room was VERY warm. Now too warm to sleep. Took a while to cool back down. Other than that everything was great. Rooms recently redone in very rich attractive decor. Breakfast extensive choices and service was efficient. Parking also was very good and there were lots of handicapped spaces right near the elevators on the lowest level. One other item they should fix, we had a walk in shower by request, but there is no where to put your soap or shampoo in the shower and the sink is too far away. But that is so minor and an easy fix.......... Hotel was beautifully deocorated for Christmas.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: ehogan
Reviews.Content: We just spent two nights at the Red Lion Hotel on Fifth Avenue. We chose this hotel since we were attending a play at the Fifth Avenue Theatre - it was just a block away. The hotel exceeded all our expectations; service was wonderful - we received an upgrade and were checked in by 1 p.m. After taking advantage of the lovely cider they were serving in the lobby we went to our room on the 10th floor with a water view. If I could buy the bed, I would! Christmas decorations were lovely as well. Across the street are two Starbucks and a lovely bakery. If you are into shopping you are right smack in the middle of the shopping district, if you are into great restaurants, they are there as well. A short walk takes you to Pike Place market. Great job, Red Lion hotel - we will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: baileysmom360
Reviews.Content: Stayed Dec 26th, for one night; a quick getaway with another couple friend. We all live in WA, but wanted to stay downtown for one night and just enjoy Seattle. Looked online until we found the hotel we wanted to stay in based on location, style, & price...this Red Lion outshines the others. We then called Red Lion reservations to get a little more information and found out we could get parking and breakfast buffet included for just a little more at a fraction of the cost…we highly recommend this! We chose a "Deluxe View - King room. They said it was on a certain floor or higher (20 floor building) and the rooms have a Bay view. When we made the reservation, we requested the best view available and were very happy with room number 1805. The lobby was nicely decorated for Christmas still and the real tree filled the lobby with a wonderful scent. Room was on the 18th floor, with a great view and very nice furnishings. The rooms have been wonderfully updated...sleek and modern, yet warm in color and finishes. The View: there are a few buildings between hotel and water, but we were high enough to enjoy ferry traffic and a partial view of Pike Place Market. Next time we’ll request the best view of the market, too. The lights at night are beautiful and the bustle of the morning routine was fun to watch. There is little to no city noise. The elevators are fast and caused some white noise in the room, but did not keep us up (we were the closest room to the elevators). I read some complaints about loud neighbors, but we heard no one. Room was very quiet & comfortable...lots of walking room and storage. The bed was a little soft for us (pillow top), but did not wake up sore. Bedding is high quality. Refrigerator in room was great to keep leftovers in. The iPod docking station was great...we streamed Pandora with free Wi-Fi, so we had just the music we wanted. The bathroom had Bath & Body Works items...awesome. The bathroom felt like a mini spa. With that came a door that is frosted glass...didn't bother us, but might have if traveling with a co-worker, etc. The tub/shower combo with extra-wide curtain rod was great, tub was slow to drain. We did need to take a trip to the grocery store around 10:30pm, the front desk was helpful in telling us what was open and where (they do have some toiletries, but not what we needed). In the end...location, location, location....4 or so blocks from Pike Place Market, 1-2 blocks from the main shopping malls. Next morning, we enjoyed the buffet; lots of hot items to choose from and helpful wait staff. Check out was a breeze because we didn't feel "nickel and dimed"...the price was the price because we had it included in our rate...again, we highly recommend this! Had parking until the afternoon, so we did some more shopping at Pacific Place before we left for the day….very nice to not have to re-park. All in all, we are Very Happy with our stay at the Red Lion, and would stay again with no worries. This is a great hotel to stay in while you show friends and family downtown Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “No overheight parking”
Reviews.Author: Brian930
Reviews.Content: Great location and value but no overheight parking which they do not disclose until you arrive. They send you to park at the Hilton a couple of blocks away so it was a pain and cost $35 bucks a day. Worse, staff was totally unsympathetic and when I asked how to get to the parking they responded, "6th and University"...nice if you know where the heck that is. They should give you a discount for the inconvenience...or at least a free drink... Overall good value for the location and rooms but you have to put up with low quality service -one exception was Allison at the front desk who was awesome to deal with, unlike the person that helped us on check in.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch”
Reviews.Author: rcraft66
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. Always my go to place when I'm in Seattle!

Reviews.Title: “Didn't sleep well once”
Reviews.Author: cardello
Reviews.Content: We researched the Red Lion online and liked its location. The pros we found with the hotel was the location in Seattle, we could walk to Pike's Market, and anywhere else we wanted, the view in our room was great and that is about it. Our room had an adjoining door to what sounded like a room holding a day car. We could hear everything going on in the room next door. Kids going crazy at 6:30AM or 11pm. Every time a door closes in the hotel it sounds like someone hit your door with a baseball bat. This hotel is HORRIBLE if you want to actually get some sleep. I didn't get a full night's sleep once. Staff seemed indifferent. The woman working the concierge desk didn't seem friendly at all. If you want a hotel with a good location check other ones out before this one.

Reviews.Title: “We did our home work before leaving Australia and were not disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: sancrox1
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a hotel in Seattle prior to our departure from Australia and read the reviews on many Hotels in Seattle before settling on the Red Lion on 5th Ave. We were not disappointed. We had just finished traveling through Canada staying in the Fairmont Hotelsand required a reasonable standard. Requirements were proximity to the Pike St markets and the centre of town,basically, everything within walking distance. We enjoyed our stay over several days on the 18th floor and dined at the Elephant and Castle down stairs which we highly recommend for variety of cuisine and service. Would we stay there again....most certainly.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Room, Central Downtown Location,”
Reviews.Author: ckpoon
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a week-long conference and found it to be very pleasurable. My room was high up on the 20th floor. The room was about 400-500 sqft with a king-size bed (no bedbugs), an 40" LCD TV, a writing desk, a chase-sofa, and free wireless Internet. The bathroom was very trendy with a nice wooden vanity and a full size tube. Water pressure was also great. Because the conference I attended provided breakfast, I didn't get a chance to try out their room service. I did have a drink down at the bar right below the hotel and had a nice time. I would stay here again in a jiffy.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service and great location!”
Reviews.Author: CeCe1769
Reviews.Content: We were in a great location for a 3 day stay in Seattle before the cruise. Walking distance to everything. Elephant & Castle Resturant located out front on the lower level had delicious food, cocktails and service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: cmetravel2010
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the hotel for 5 nights for a trip to Seattle. Our first time to Seattle so didn't know what to expect but we wanted to be in downtown to be close to everything. The location was one of the best things about the hotel. Pros: Can't beat the location. Downtown close to alot of shopping, food and sights. Rooms are updated. Fitness center is available 24/7. Good view of the bay or city from room. Free WiFi was great. Great value for the price. Cons: Walls alittle thin, could hear room next door coming back at midnight. Bathroom is clean and updated but alittle small. Buffet breakfast is 12.95/person so we ate at the cafe across the street which was really good. Overall, I would recommend it. Its a great value for the price and can't beat the location. Everyone was friendly. No major issues. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and great rooms!”
Reviews.Author: inkwave17
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Red Lion for a work conference and was overall extremely pleased with my experience. The hotel is in a great location, easily within walking distance of Pike Place, major retail outlets, ferries, etc. The rooms themselves were also large, clean and very comfortable, with nice views of the city (at least on upper floors). The shower had great water pressure too, which I always find a plus when you want to scrub the airplane feeling off! Conference facilities were adequate and the food at both breakfast and lunch was very good. I would stay away from the box lunches though, which did not seem fresh at all. Too bad, as everything else was great! The attached pub is also nice for a drink in the evening and is large enough to accomodate big groups, although the service was a bit slow (one bartender for a place with 40-50 people in it is not enough!). There is also a business center, somewhat awkwardly located in a separate building, but you can print boarding passes here for free. The staff of the hotel was pleasant enough, but I wouldn't say especially friendly or helpful. In fact, the concierge was actually quite rude at one point. Why bother having a surly concierge? All in all though, I think this place is a great option since you are in the middle of everything and the rates were very reasonable considering the quality of the rooms and location. I would definitely recommend it if you are looking for a decent place to stay in downtown Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel. Great Value.”
Reviews.Author: CACAtraveler
Reviews.Content: Arrived in Seattle for a short stay downtown. Got an excellent rate at the Red Lion online. On arrival, the front desk staff was awesome about giving me directions and recommendations. I got a great room with a view of Elliott Bay. The room was clearly newly renovated and matched anything you'd get for a lot more $$$ over at the W Hotel. Very clean and well kept. The bed was soft and sweet and there was little or no noise from the other rooms on the floor. I've never stayed at a Red Lion before, but I highly recommend this place if you're staying in downtown Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: Enjw
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our first trip to Seattle. We were in town to catch a cruise ship to Alaska. This hotel is very nice and the staff were all extremely helpful. We had baggage shipped via Fedex to the hotel before our arrival and they took care of it until we arrived. The hotel is a short walk from Pike Place Market, which is awesome, and a longer walk to most of downtown Seattle's attractions. Next time I am in Seattle, I will definitely be staying here again

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel close to the convention center.”
Reviews.Author: blackford1
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel. Rooms were average size. Bathroom on the small size but adequate. Free internet, which is unusual for downtown hotels. Nice deck on the fifth floor with views of the city and the water, which was a good place for early evening drinks. British restaurant/pub on the bottom level was open late and was also very good. Five minute walk from subway, convention center, or monorail to space needle. Ten minute walk to the fish market. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and Location nice clean spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: albodo11
Reviews.Content: This hotel was right downtown, close to public transportation, and within walking distance to Macys, Nordstroms, and Pike Place Market. a quick monorail ride to the space needle. the rooms were clean and spacious, and service was friendly and willing to assist us and answer lots of questions. meals are more expensive than the avareage but all around great

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: TallahasseeMary
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on a review of how easy it was to get there. It's a fantastic location in Seattle, a brief walk down to Pike's street market and centrally located to just about everything. We took the recently opened Light Link Metro to Westlake station and walked the two blocks to the hotel. When we left it was 6 AM and I felt completely safe walking the streets. You can't beat it for location, the staff was polite and the food was tasty at the restaurant though we never made it to breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Big Hotel & Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Marcus_O_Really
Reviews.Content: In town for business and baseball game. King room was clean and nice. Standard modern room. Bed was comfortable. TV modern. Great location downtown. Decent parking underground. Only drawback was a long check in line. Not " awesome" but I'd recommend it, although would probably change it up next time for a change of pace.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: ruffy10
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent!! Rooms were beautifully decorated beds were very comfortable bathroom was really spacious and clean, and an excellent locatiion. Free internet so kids happy!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel but beware the parking!”
Reviews.Author: mrbmufc
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five nights at the beginning of August 2010. The hotel is in a really good location with walking distance to Pike Place Market. The rooms are comfortable and clean with all modern ammenities. We really had no complaints about the hotel at all. The only thing to becareful with is the parking which is $33 a night. We thought this was a hell of an amount for one nights as residents. Would recommend the hotel to anyone visiting Seattle without a car. Free wifi was a bonus too.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, great location but...”
Reviews.Author: lilacbirman13
Reviews.Content: We stayed overnight, the location is great and the hotel itself was in good condition. We got a great deal online but then upgraded for a small fee to get a great room with water views. We got two rooms and both were nice, modern, clean and comfy. Very roomy with king sized bed, desk/chair, reading chair w/footstool but the reading light was not bright enough. The bathroom was nice with good lighting but the water from the shower head only sprayed out from the outter perimeter and not the center so rinsing the shampoo out of my hair was a bit of a challenge. The bathroom door has a large frosted glass panel so you can see the person inside sitting on the toilet or wiping themselves off out of the shower. That is strange and posed a bit uncomfortable for my 13 year old son and his grandmother who where roommates. The business center is across a breezeway, then downstairs which could be uncomfortable for a woman alone. There were four of five computers which are free for printing airline tickets. For the internet, the first few minutes were free then your CC is charged. Don't recall how much since we didn't use it. The front desk staff were nice but the concierge, yikes! The first day I noticed the concierge just sitting at the desk staring out the door looking totally bored. In fact he looked as if he was about to fall asleep. When I asked him about a particular store, he simply said it had closed years ago, no smile. No suggestions of other places I might be intrested in, no giving of a map or anything. The next day there was a different guy but he looked equally bored. They really need to have these guys actually doing something so they at least looked busy or better yet, they need better people for the job. There is a restaurant downstairs which serves a buffet breakfast, STAY AWAY! Ugh, for $12.95 it was awful. The pancakes were freshly made via a machine which was okay but don't expect fluffy pancakes as those were flat. The scrambled eggs were not good so I didn't finish them. The fruits were floating in water so I didn't bother with them but my mother said they were tasteless. The other selections were bacon, sausage, muffins, cereal, for the money this so called buffet was not worth it. The juices were too sweet even my teenager commented on it. I regret not ordering from the menu. Overall, the hotel is nice, great location and the price was fair. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this place but don't know if I would stay here again only because I prefer boutique type hotels like the Mayflower Park.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff-although a little disorganized”
Reviews.Author: PoorTripPlanner
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a few nights pre cruise in May. The hotel is located in an excellent spot, in my opinion. The rate was very good for the particular nights that I booked (about the price of a 3* at the time) But I felt it was more like a 3* than a 4*. Seemed like it was everyone's first day. By that I mean that staff just seemed to look confused or lost with regard to basic questions or requests. Not mean or nasty, just confused. I wouldn't be against going back to the Red Lion; however, it wouldn't be my 1st choice. Since then I have stayed at the Grand Hyatt and the Fairmont Olympic and found those hotels to greatly surpass my experience at Red Lion. I would recommend those before the RedLion

Reviews.Title: “Great location...average room”
Reviews.Author: trip2323
Reviews.Content: Great location, walking distance to most major Seattle attractions (Pikes place market, Safeco field, Space Needle, good restaurants). Parking is expensive, but it's located downtown so thats expected (39.00 including taxes). Room was clean but decorating was very dark. No trouble with noise and our room was right by the elevator. Free wireless internet was a major plus. Fitness center was clean and had 4 treadmills and other machines/weights. Overall would stay here again for the location.

Reviews.Title: “One night before Alaskan Cruise - will definitley be going back!”
Reviews.Author: kricket88
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the night before leaving on an Alaskan Cruise. What a great hotel!! It's in a great location - Pikes Market is only a few blocks away as is the Monorail to the Space Needle, and there are great shopping and fantastic restaurants all within walking distance. No need for rental cars at all. The rooms were very clean & spacious, and the staff was very friendly. My only regret is that I didn't have more time to spend in Seattle. What a great city! I will for sure be going back, and when I do I will be sure to stay at the Red Lion!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Do It”
Reviews.Author: redneckinthecity
Reviews.Content: Had a 4 day conference at the hotel and my wife came along for the trip. The hotel is very conveniently located in downtown Seattle. We tolerated the room next to the elevator the first night. But the toilet with the pressure tank that leaks and periodically sounds like a machine gun, combined with being next to the ice machine was more than we could handle by night #2. Add to that a front desk clerk whose smart-aleck response to my request for an extra room card was unprofessional and not the kind of reply i expect at a hotel that hosts business travelers. I called the following morning and asked to have maintenance fix the toilet. When I returned later, the noise remained but the desk assured my wife that it was repaired. When I protested, I was offered a new room, which I gladly took but am reluctant to see what awaits us tonight. And I feel sorry for the poor fool who will spend the night in room 1417 and endure the noisy toilet tonight. The Westin isn't as convenient, and is more expensive, but worth it to avoid bad staff and bad facilities. DON'T DO IT!

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is nice and the staff of...”
Reviews.Author: bonogirl20
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice and the staff of helpful (not to be confused with friendly). The location is perfect for any Seattle tourist, for it's in the heart of downtown and walking distance to Pike place market, Seattle Art Museum, the Monorail, and in the middle of a great shopping district. The rooms are not big, but clean, nice, and most have a view. There's no longer a free breakfast, parking is over $30/day, the business center does not provide free Internet access, and refrigirators are included in the rooms. Great location, and would recommend the place just for that.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! Wonderful place and people.”
Reviews.Author: Nutcrakerz
Reviews.Content: I had visited Seattle for a Business meet and stayed in Red Lion, 5th Ave. The hotel is in a great location and if lucky you could catch a glimpse of the sea from your room. It is walking distance to beautiful shops (JC Penny), great restaurants (CrabPot), Shopping Malls (Ross), Seattle Aquarium and to Pike's Market. Monorail and Bus stop is 2 blocks away. Room Service is pretty good and the staff are always polite, respectful, and accommodating. The complimentary shampoos and soaps are awesome. I have never had a problem sleeping. Downside: $32 a day parking and no pool.

Reviews.Title: “good location, kids wished for pool”
Reviews.Author: stpauliewoman
Reviews.Content: could not be much closer to the action. We walked everywhere. Kind of congested during a marathon and the following day's Gay pride parade but we could still get around. Downside: $32 a day parking and no pool

Reviews.Title: “Great expectations.... mediocre reality”
Reviews.Author: frequent-flyer21
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly ok, but we had higher expectations based on the reviews and the 'hype'. We had booked a room with a view, and were given one on the 6th floor. View? Its was mostly other buildings in front of the hotel! If you looked really close you could just see a small area of ocean...! The airconditioning in our room was very hard to control. It was hard to stop it continually cooling down, whatever temp was set. And there was no way to turn off the fan (Well, if there was it was impossibly hard to find!!!) Breakfast was included in our rate, but only if we had the buffet. There was no possibility of getting a credit against a la carte breakfast. The buffet was VERY bedicre for a hotel of this calibre, with a poor selection. I've had better in a Holiday Inn! On the plus side..... the location is excellent, very convenient for all areas of the city. The concierge was very helpful. And 5 stars ***** for the excellent happy hour. Otherwise, not worth the high price!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: renettalowenstein
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location - walking distance to beautiful shops, great restaurants , art museum and to Pike's Market. You are two blocks to the monorail that takes you directly to the Space Needle. Don't miss happy hour on their 5th floor rooftop restaurant and bar. The hotel rooms are very clean and spacious. The king size bed was very comfortable. Most importantly the front desk staff were so sweet and helpful. On the last day of our stay at the hotel, my husband was feeling really miserable with a bad cold. The manager was very kind to allow him to stay a few hours past checkout time so that he could rest before our flight that night. We were very grateful for his kindness. I recommend this hotel very highly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Room!”
Reviews.Author: JayTC
Reviews.Content: I would stay here again for it's location! Hotel is right in downtown, retail core area. block and a half to monorail, buses, and train station. I even walked to Pike Market [about 4-5 blocks away]. I stayed on 7th floor and my room was well maintained and in a good condition. Bath and body work amenities and free wifi are a plus. Hotel lobby is quite small but I don't really care :) 5th floor has restaurant with outdoor patio area and a tiny fitness room. Overall, 3 nights stay at Red Lion was a good time for me and I recommend this hotel for anyone [family, business trip, solo traveler, couple ect. ]

Reviews.Title: “Parking Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: RockiesDenver
Reviews.Content: Please be warned anyone with a car--the hotel charges $30 a night to park and even assesses taxes on each night. It comes out to $35 a night to park. The staff is unsympathetic to the charges and I was not prewarned abou the extra expense. The room was fine, but know the room amenities are limited. ALso be sure to ask about the breakfast voucher--no one told me about it and therefore did not get a free breakfast. Last they do have a business center in the attached building however no one is there to assist you. The computers would log out unexpectedly--be prepared to spend more time and money being online.

Reviews.Title: “Great central hotel.Rooms very good .”
Reviews.Author: Alfdee
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in the centre of town.Good for Pike Market,Seattle aquarium and near to the metro link to the space needle.Good pub attached -The elephant and castle.Rooms clean and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend the Red Lion”
Reviews.Author: Tristan017
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for three nights through expedia and got a great rate with a packaged vacation. This hotel was far nicer then I expected looking at some of the reviews posted on tripadvisor. We had a terrific stay here with no complaints. The location of the Red Lion can't be beat. We took the light rail in from the airport for $2.50 and walked 2 blocks to the hotel. The hotel is right in the middle of the shopping district and a short walk to Pikes Market and many other attractions. We were given a terrific room on the 17th floor and were allowed to check in early. Bed was very comfortable. Room was spacious and clean. Room decor was nice. Elevators were fast. Cleaning staff was great. The staff in the lobby were friendly. Had no trouble with temperature in our room as previous reviewers did. Nice restaurant lounge on the 5th floor and fun pub at the hotel entrance. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations - great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Allison_Yr
Reviews.Content: I booked through Priceline for a great price and then read the reviews here. I was worried based on some recent reviews, but this hotel was excellent. The location was perfect - we could walk to restaurants, movie theaters, shopping, and Pike Place Market. We walked to the Monorail which took us to Seattle Center and the Space Needle. We also walked to the Link Light Rail which took us to Pioneer Square and the airport. No need for a car for a short trip anyway. The room was spacious and beautifully decorated. We were given a water view, which was a nice surprise. Our King bed was honestly the most comfortable hotel bed I have ever slept in. I am usually very uncomfortable and wake frequently in hotels, but I slept better than I do in my own bed at the Red Lion. We ate at the Elephant & Castle and enjoyed it, but did not try the Terrace Restaurant. For airport travel, there is an $11 each way shuttle called the Grayline Airporter that leaves from a block away. It does not run past 9 p.m. however, so we did the Link Light Rail one way, and the shuttle the other way. Worked out just fine. One more thing - appreciated the free high-speed Internet. That is hard to come by these days.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre”
Reviews.Author: WorkingMom74
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location and if you pay more for the higher floors, the view is nice. Overall, though, it is not a very family-friendly hotel and its amenities are limited. The room is nice enough and they provided ample towels and bath & body works shampoo and conditioner. Bed was comfortable and the room was good sized. There was no microwave but there was a small box refridgerator that was set to very cold and could not be adjusted. The A/C or heat was uncontrollable so the room was either chilly or unbearably hot and no turning of the knob could adjust it. This made sleep quality poor. The roaring start breakfast was disappointing because it cost about $8 per person, so if it is not complimentary, I would like more options in food. I did not think the food was worth the price -- i have eaten the same for free at any Holiday Inn. By the way, you have to ask for vouchers at the front desk for the breakfast -- you cant just pay at the restaurant should you decide to go. The cable programming for the TV was NOT family-friendly. There were about 10 sports channels but the only family channels were Cartoon network (and that is NOT often for children) or ABC Family. Would have liked a Disney channel or Nick channel. Roll-aways/cribs cost an extra $20 per night. One day I did not get a newspaper (and all the other rooms around mine did) but when I asked the front desk, they told me, "Sorry, we ran out of them." All in all, it seems one is paying for the location of the hotel rather than amenities. It is no better than the average budget hotel for amenities. I would try another hotel if I returned.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: beans0308
Reviews.Content: The location is top notch. However the room we were assgined to had a broken thermostat. It blew out very warm air at the highest setting it seems. I called front desk 3 times and all 3 times they brushed me off telling me simply to try to reset the thermostat by turing it up and down several times. If that doesn't work they told me that was all the options they have so pretty much for me to deal with it. In my opinion the hotel is 3*. Staff needs better customer service training. Not very caring to customers needs. This hotel can be so much better if they just tried harder. I wouldn't come back again

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: NewMexicoSunshine
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the heart of downtown. Its located in the shopping district of downtown Seattle so if you like to shop, this is the hotel for you! Once you walk out the doors, you can see the original Nordstorms just a couple blocks away. The hotel is right across the street from the City Center building which has a starbucks, gym, and a small restaurant as well as some stores. As we mingled with other tourists, they all were jealous of our hotel's location! Pike Place Market is within walking distance as well as the monorail station to take to Seattle Center which is where the Space Needle is. The hotel staff were extreemly friendly and helpful. The hotel was always really clean and nice. The breakfast buffet is a really great value and the food is actually really good! The bar and grill downstairs has great food as well!

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: jooheaThroop
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Red Lion for 1 night before our Alaskan cruise. It was a perfect location for seeing the sights in Seattle. The Space Needle is 10 minutes away and the Fish Market is a 5 minute walk. The hotel was clean and the service was very good. Also the price was reasonable for all it offered.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money ?”
Reviews.Author: trident3
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at the Red Lion on a number of business trips over the last 4 years. Its central location in Downtown Seattle makes it ideal . The rooms are large , clean and well equiped . The 5th floor breakfast buffet is not very exciting (or good value) . The over night parking fee of $30.00 is a real negative in my opinion . The Elephant & Castle Pub is a delight . I would recommend to anyone as a reasonable value downtown hotel , but beware perfection it is not

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for the money.”
Reviews.Author: voodoomagic
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 10 days and was very impressed by the size of the room and the tasteful decor. The staff was very helpful and polite. I also got a room with a wonderful view. The hotel is very centrally located, and within close walking distance from Pike Market, and just about every downtown location worth visiting. I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ColumbiaTrekkers
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Red Lion for several days on two separate trips to Seattle in September. The hotel provides excellent value -- very nice, professionally designed rooms, a great location close to Pike Place Market and other downtown amenities. I have no complaints. I intend to stay here every time I'm in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel. Pleasant service. Clean room.”
Reviews.Author: luhyus
Reviews.Content: Clean room, fluffy towels, quiet, pleasant staff, perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “They try--but it's not enough”
Reviews.Author: LauraLatte
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night for a downtown holiday shopping trip. Booked two rooms for the four of us so we could all have our own bed. While the location is fantastic, the service and amenities were lackluster. I have stayed in nearby 4-star properties and received far-superior benefits. A free parking promo was why I ultimately booked the Red Lion, and while I did save $35, in the end I was unhappy with the hotel experience. I called about a week before our stay to verify the reservation and request adjoining rooms. When I checked in at 3 PM, I again requested the adjoining rooms. I was told they needed to be cleaned and would I like to wait or receive rooms on different floors. Their estimated wait time of 30 minutes turned into almost two hours. When we arrived at the rooms they were next to each other without an inside adjoining door. I called down to reception and was informed that they had no adjoining rooms in the hotel, and when they said "adjoining" they just meant "next to." Seriously? They did not clarify this at any time, though several calls and front-desk chats, and we would not have waited almost two hours for rooms without an inside door. The accommodations themselves had old, noisy climate controls and nice flat-screen TVs with no DVD player or pay movies, though they did have an iPod docking station. The cable channels on the TV were grainy. The bathrooms were clean and the towels plentiful. Since it was the holidays, they had cookies and warm cider in the lobby, but not all evening. The parking garage was always packed and is poorly designed in that you often find yourself at the end of it with no way to turn around. Many spots are off-limits for the adjacent bank.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience!”
Reviews.Author: NJBH
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to experience downtown Seattle, Very pleasant staff,nice rooms, a good shower. It is really in a convenient location in the heart of downtown,but not difficult to find from I-5. Nice fireplace in lobby,good for couples and people on business... very good breakfast and I got a super rate with underground heated parking included.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: boban70
Reviews.Content: Very nice and large rooms. Modern design. Professional stuff. Amazing location. I don't know why it is not rated as a 4 1/2 hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: kevincognito
Reviews.Content: We have been to Seattle countless times but have never stayed downtown for fear of the price. We booke ddirectly with the hotel and got a AAA rate of $134. Let me tell you for the price, even with and extra $30 parking fee, it was well worth it. When we got there, we parked the car and did not have to use it again until the day we left. Pikes Place was 6 blocks and the shopping strip was 2 blocks. We saw a Seahawk game and Quest field was about 14 block... well within walking distance. Now the hotel itself does not look that impressive when you drive up compared to the more modern downtown hotels but the rooms are plenty adeqaute and comparable to a new hotel. The only minor complaint from my wife is that there was not enough lights in the room. We tried the restaurant for breakfast only and they give you a $20 voucher per night you stay which doesn't quite cover the cost of the breakfast but I thought was still a nice value inlcuded in the room cost. The concierge and front desk were very helpful in dinner and entertainment selections. We will be staying here again most definately.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: dimi_sf
Reviews.Content: we really liked this hotel! especially for that price we've got! - I guess it was one of hot deals, because our travel package incl air fare was very very competitive (usually their rates are higher, but still good enough) we've got a pretty large room with two double beds, big bathroom, all amenities incl - a coffee maker, a fridge, a hair dryer... when we checked in one of the light bulbs did not work, but the maintenance guy came within 10 mins to change it - even thought it was like 11pm well, smtimes in happens - bulbs don't work) but in general the room was very well maintained the hotel is only few blocks from monorail station, walkable distance to Pike Place Market. there's also a shuttle stop from/to airport - at Sheraton, just a block away

Reviews.Title: “Red Lion Fifth Avenue Seattle location is the BEST”
Reviews.Author: YellowstoneGal
Reviews.Content: The Red Lion Hotel Fifth Avenue is unbelievably well-located to conduct business in at the (excellent) Seattle Trade and Convention Center (two blocks to the north east) while enjoying the pleasures of the central city, chief among them, the Pike Place Market (four blocks south west), plus myriad restaurants, major arts centers, Nordstrom and Nordstrom Rack, the monorail to the Space Needle, and all the Starbucks you can drink, within easy walking distance (don’t forget your umbrella). Check-in was very competent and pleasant; I had sent myself a package and was notified immediately upon check-in that it was waiting for me. Our 11th floor room was roomy and comfortable enough, with two queen beds and a view of Puget Sound and, when the clouds lifted, Bainbridge Island in full Fall glory beyond. Lighting was notably insufficient. On the other hand, the wi-fi is free and dependable. The beds were comfortable, but the sheets had major issues: (see photo) and threatened every night to come unmoored. The pillows were too high and firm. Once we figured out the apparently uncalibrated thermostat had to be set at about 80o, the room temperature was comfortable. The closet door is on an inconvenient auto-closer but the hangers are real wood, on real hooks, thank you very much. There are also two big fluffy robes in that closet. In the room are: a hair dryer, the usual coffee maker and packets of icky coffee (who needs that in Seattle!), iron and board, fancy clock radio, a big flat-screen TV (with 46 channels listed but only about 25 available, of which about six were sports, and a couple in Spanish). There is also a very convenient dorm-sized fridge for cooling your own food and drinks, but no mini-bar. We found it to be essentially a quiet hotel, except for some periodic mysterious mechanical rumblings like little gremlins bowling in the ventilation system. The bathroom has the same hang-tags as everyplace these days: if you are willing to re-use your towels, hang them up on a rack, blah-blah. Indeed, the housekeepers did not take away our towels (but helpfully, did leave us fresh ones), which we were happy to use for a couple of days, but there is nothing resembling a functional towel rack in the bathroom, in favor, alas, of trendy décor and uninteresting art. This is my plea to all hotels: skip the art, please give us enough feet of towel rack so we can hang ‘em up to dry!! Hot water was quickly forthcoming and pressure was adequate. The vanity is pretty granite, but the lighting could have been better. We used the parking garage under the hotel. The rate is $30 (plus tax) with in-out privileges. Take a look at your charges before checkout. We were billed for all five nights we stayed in the hotel even though we used only two garage nights. The front desk readily made the correction, commenting that the garage is run by a concessionaire and that they often make such mistakes. Oddly, the Red Lion’s full-service Terrace Garden restaurant on the fifth floor was not listed in the guest directory in our room. My one meal there, breakfast, was enjoyable (though not especially cheap), the service quick, and the coffee good. However, beware the “grapefruit juice.” It was watery and sweetened, i.e., grapefruit drink. I told waitress I was disappointed, and all she said was, “Oh, it’s Ocean Spray something-or-other” (really!) instead of apologizing. It would have been more appropriate to take it off my bill, but not worth making an issue of. Speaking of food, a great alternative for breakfast, lunch, or a light dinner, is Specialty’s, bakery/deli/sandwich/coffee shop across the street, on the corner of Fifth and Union. They offer very good sandwiches made to order on excellent bread (try the turkey and cranberry on herb bread!), all kinds of muffins and cookies, soups, and the like, eat-in or take-out, very reasonably priced. On the suggestion of the front desk clerk, we made our way to Gambas, a “Japanese-French” restaurant, for first rate sushi one evening. On another evening we went down to the Waterfront and had an amazing clam bake at Ivar’s. Both these eateries are seafood *heaven* Of course at Pike Place Market there are dozens of places to eat anything your heart, or stomach, might desire. Don’t skip the experience of strolling around the market–allow a couple of hours at least. It’s glorious! All in all, we absolutely loved being in downtown Seattle, and the Red Lion is in the heart of the action. I wouldn’t hesitate to stay there again anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: CarolinaBulldog
Reviews.Content: Pros - The rooms! Our room was very large and updated with gorgeous furnishings. We also had great views. The location! The hotel location is excellent - just a few blocks from the waterfront and downtown attractions. The light rail and bus station is right around the corner, which made traveling in from the airport a breeze. The breakfast buffet was also good and the great views continued at the restaurant. Cons - Customer service - The woman who checked us in seemed annoyed to have to be doing anything, really. We had the AAA discount and had to tell her that our rate included breakfast after she handed us the keys to be on our way. You would have thought we asked her to bring our luggage in from the rain! She seemed very bothered by having to help us at all. Also, the walls must be really thin as we could hear the entire conversation from the next room - every word - which kept us awake as they decided whether or not to go out for drinks because it was so late. Overall the rooms and location made this a great hotel and I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Below Average”
Reviews.Author: Truenorth978
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a very convenient location for exploring Seattle. The lobby is nice except it acts as a pass-thru for people going to work in the morning. I had two different rooms on my stay due to the loud noises the showers were making, like the pipes were going to burst through the walls. Both were dark and did not offer much of a view. I asked to be moved to a higher floor and they were not able to grant my request, although my assistant had called a day earlier and was told this was not going to be a problem. The rooms were very dark even with the lights on and there were switches that never turned on anything. Because of the issue with the showers in two different rooms I was not impressed. The service was lacking as well. I reported my shower problem twice and was told that it would be taken care of, which it never was. I was the one who had to request another room. The concierge acted like I was bothering her and that she had more important things to do than answer my questions. Funny how her attitude changed when on the last night there I asked about dinner reservations and stated that I had already made them at the Capital Grille but may want to eat closer to the water. Finding out that I was eating at one of the more expensive establishments definitely caused her to change her tune. She was also very disorganized. Overall I would not stay there again and would not recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Was not welcoming, and there was NO SECURITY”
Reviews.Author: samas3
Reviews.Content: The desk staff when checking in were not friendly. There was a parking garage attendant in their parking garage, however our car window was broken out and we were robbed, along with another car next to us. We found out later that the garage had the same trouble a couple of weeks ago, and yet they charged us $40.00 to park there!! There was no security stopping anyone from the street to enter the elevators in the hotel, where they had total access to the floors and parking garage. Our room door would not latch. When we left our room luckily we pushed on the door to check it, it did not shut. We called to have it fixed, and no help ever arrived. On the good side, the room was clean, and the view was wonderful.. Room Service was very good, and the waiter very helpful. We will however, never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Downtown Seattle”
Reviews.Author: yoyo27California
Reviews.Content: Had a great, 4 night stay at the Red Lion on 5th Avenue. Location is very convenient to many major attractions. Facilities are very nice, and the staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location and comfortable rooms!”
Reviews.Author: zvezda9
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel rather last minute and got a great deal, but I would definitely return the next time I come to Seattle. The location cannot be beat, and the parking, while pricey to some, was not expensive compared to other major cities and very convenient to the hotel and with in-and-out priviledges. I have read that the facility was recently remodeled, which one could tell from the rooms but not the corridors, which looked a little bland and smelled funny most of the time (which was perhaps from room service deliveries). The rooms, though, were clean and spacious. The TV was a newer flat-screen model, and the beds appeared to have newer linens and bedspreads. The bathrooms were reasonably sized, and they featured Bath and Body Works products in popular scents. There were a few negatives, but they were not deal breakers for me. The biggest would be that the climate control was finicky. When we first arrived, we could not get it to turn on, so I had to call the front desk, who said they would turn it cooler. Later that night it was still having problems, but the desk this time suggested turning the knob all the way to the coldest setting and then back a few notches. (It was just a switch on the wall, not an actual window system, as prevalent in many hotels.) While it did cool off later, the room often felt stuffy when we returned from being outside. Also, there was some noise one of the nights, but it was temporary and the hotel cannot control every guest for every minute.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected Excellence! Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: formerlyh
Reviews.Content: This was the first time we booked a hotel in downtown Seattle and we weren't sure what to expect. Well, the Red Lion on 5th Avenue in Seattle put all our worries to rest and then some! The hotel has recently been remodeled, so everything was brand new with modern, yet classic decor. However, the best thing about the hotel BY FAR is it’s location: literally, right in the heart of the best downtown Seattle shopping (Anthropologie, Banana Republic, GAP, Betsey Johnson, H&M, Nordstrom, Macy’s, etc.) and just a few blocks away from Pike Place Market, easily within walking distance. If you are ever there on a week day morning, head down to Pike Place before the crowds arrive and observe the vendors set up while you walk through an almost empty market; it will be a completely different experience than you’ve ever had there before! On your way back to the hotel, make sure you stop by Piroshky Piroshky, directly across the street from the Market; you won’t be disappointed. The only downside we found to the hotel is the lack of a pool/sauna/hot tub; however, you will be so busy shopping or exploring downtown Seattle, you may not miss it at all! We’ve already been spreading the word about this place, and even decided while we were there that when we return to Seattle, there is no other place we want to stay but the Red Lion on 5th Ave!

Reviews.Title: “The place did nothing BUT impress me.”
Reviews.Author: MyJadedSpirit
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Red Lion Sept 2-9th during the Penny Arcade Expo, and as gamers, we don't expect the best reception because of the stereotypes. I've had horrible and okay hotel experiences for gaming events before, and the hotel could be rude or just turn a blind eye to any simple request. However, the Red Lion was the most welcoming hotel and vacation experience I've ever had. I stayed with my S/O and my best friend, and the room was more then big enough for the three of us, even after we collected bags full of swag from the convention center so convieniently located less then 2 blocks away. Everything was near by, eating, entertainment, shopping. It never got to be 'too far' to walk to your destination, because it was likely just afew blocks away. The hotel staff blew us all away, always eager to help and accommodating with whatever questions or concerns we had. One in particular, Alex (who works the front desk), went above and beyond with how engaging and friendly he was. When we asked if the hotel supplied DVD players, he went the extra mile and brought in his own DVD player from home for us to use! When deciding that we were going to stay again next year for the event, they gave us tours of the suites and the bigger rooms and helped us build a plan as to what kind of connecting rooms we could get and what the cost differences would be. Talking to both the active manager one of the days, and the general manager the next day, we had nothing but compliments for the hotel. You could tell she was proud of her hotel, and her staff, and she had every right to be. There isn't a person I wouldn't recommend this hotel to. She (I believe her name was Shannon Sharon) was extremely friendly and gave us all of her contact information for planning in the future. The only very very petty grumbles I had, were that the elevators move so fast, that your ears actually pop, which took afew days to get used to, and that the bathroom doors were kind of an opaque glass pattiern that wasn't very hard to see through, right in front of the toilet, which was very unnerving staying in a room with two males. I look forward to next year when I can plan going back to the Red Lion again, it was definitely worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Review - notes on their pub”
Reviews.Author: 4nRelations_Inexpert
Reviews.Content: Regarding The Red Lion's Elephant and Castle Pub. We stumbled upon this little gem when desperate for something to quench our thirst. How lucky we were! Excellent beer, clean and nice bar (HUGE) inside and a nice little streetside terrace out to the side (where we sat). They were not really serving outside but the very kind and attentive bartender accommodated us. Never once were we without cool mugs of beer and lots of good appetizers. We stayed for a couple hours. They have a couple happy hours. One starting at three. If we did not have to get somewhere, we would have stayed. In fact, the next time we are in town, we are going to check the rates on the Red Lion. It looked very nice, it's location was good and central and it looked clean, safe and I bet it is a good value. Plus you could walk easily to the symphony. In heels! In any case, we will go back to the pub. If you are staying there, don't skip it. Good value, friendly good service and a huge selection of beer on tap.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Bit_Chick
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because of its location and reviews. I was happy with the hotel. Rooms were spacious, clean, affordable, and in a great location. Our main purpose of the trip was shopping and and baseball game. Shopping is in walking distance, we walked to the baseball park, but took a Taxi back. Would definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: mr88oh
Reviews.Content: My room was called "Classic Single Queen." It was beautifully decorated and everything was functional, but it is on the small side. It's best for a single traveler, only. I was at the hotel during the Great Seattle Heat Wave which could account for the less than friendly front desk service. But, with persistence, my questions were answered correctly and completely. The hotel restaurant served an excellent breakfast. There are several nice restaurants nearby, including the Cheesecake Factory. It's also close to the convention center. All of the Seattle tourist destinations are nearby, or easy to get to from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, great location, great price”
Reviews.Author: angcpell
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in the center of everything - close to Pike Place Market and the monorail which takes you into the city center (Space Needle area). The rooms were recently renovated, free WiFi, and very clean. Flat screen TV. Get the best price by searching on kayak.com. We also loved the Elephant & Castle restaurant which is just outside the lobby. Outdoor seating and great food.

Reviews.Title: “Great location walking distance to most places otherwise free bus zone”
Reviews.Author: HMS5
Reviews.Content: My sisters and I do an annual trip to watch our home team (Angels) play in an away park. It gives us a chance to explore a new city each year and enjoy baseball. We were on the 16th floor with a great view of Elliott Bay (booked through Expedia); clean and spacious room, comfortable beds, free internet. The Red Lion was centrally located; walk a few blocks to Pike's Market (recommend Savor Seattle Tours for food tours of the Pike), we also walked to the Underground tour (if you want to learn Seattle history this is the way to go), the ferries are a little bit of walk, but do able (went to Bainbridge Island for dinner and came back after dark for a view of the city lights, beautiful), can walk to the Needle, but suggest taking the monorail back. The Music Experience musuem which is located by the Needle, is a must if you love Jimi Hendrix, guitars, want to experiment with making your own music (CD), or want to learn about the musicans of the Northwest. This museum is part of the Science Fiction museum, which was actually quite interesting, even if you don't fancy yourself as a Sci-Fi person. Lots of great restaurants and shopping all around the hotel. If you arrive late (we checked in at 10:00 PM) the Elephant Pub on the lower level of the hotel served up some good drinks and food with a late happy hour. All the hotel staff were friendly. The ball parks are just outside the free bus ride zone, so we got off at the end and enjoyed the 2 block walk through all the food vendors. We took a taxi after the game to the needle to enjoy the night view ($10.00) but worth it, then took the monorail back to our hotel. If you are staying in Seattle, a car really is not necessary.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in downtown Seattle”
Reviews.Author: vancouver_petunia
Reviews.Content: Stayed just one Saturday night at this central hotel. Got a good rate on Hotwire and was pleasantly surprised. Room was large with two comfortable queen beds, desk & flatscreen TV with high def signal. We were the first room off the elevator on the 8th floor (room 806, I think), but it was still relatively quiet until about 8am when people started leaving for the day. Loved the Bath & Body Works toiletries. Could have done without the $30 + $3 tax parking charge. But I guess it is downtown Seattle, so pricey parking is to be expected. A mid-range hotel with a few upscale touches.

Reviews.Title: “Big beautiful room, very clean, very convenient, close to everything.”
Reviews.Author: PJGRx
Reviews.Content: Checked-in on a Sunday morning after a 7 day cruise, and were very happy that room was ready when we arrived. Had a quiet 10th floor room, facing the waterfront. Could see Elliott Bay (Puget Sound) between buildings, but was still nice. Room was huge, 2 queen beds and very clean. Flat screen TV, mini fridge, and coffee pot w/ complimentary coffee. Shopped locally and kept breakfast food in the mini fridge. The only thing I thought was strange was the bathroom door had a full-size frosted glass panel which didn't give a good sense of privacy. The air conditioning worked extremely well, and we were grateful, since there was a heat wave in Seattle, and we'd heard that many area hotels don't have A/C. The staff was very helpful and friendly. Received good tourist information and recommendations from the Reception Desk staff, and received valuable help from them in printing our return flight boarding passes after having trouble doing so in the adjacent business center. Located in the heart of the shopping district, it was easy to walk a few short blocks to get to everything, like the waterfront (Pike Place Market, restaurants, the Aquarium, Harbor cruises and ferries) and also to the monorail station. Space needle and nearby museums are about a 15-20 min walk, which was nice in the pleasant weather, but could also access these areas more quickly on the monorail. The hotel is located in the free bus zone (6am-7pm) which also made getting around very easy. Pioneer Square was a convenient short bus ride away. Enjoyed our stay, and would stay here again when returning to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a hotel hidden in plain sight”
Reviews.Author: KristinaLF
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travel to Seattle from Portland occasionally for weekend getaways. Over the years, we have stayed in many hotels, but this was our first visit to the Red Lion on 5th Avenue. The hotel exceeded all our expectations, and I would not hesitate to recommend it. The location is perfect, and we has a beautiful and spacious room on the 14th floor with a great view of the bay. It was clean, quiet and comfortable. The entire staff was polite, eager to make our stay as comfortable as possible and always gave us the impression that they really enjoyed their work. The hotel has an outdoor dining area on the 5th floor which we really enjoyed as the weather was warm and sunny. The food and service was excellent. I am already planning another trip and will stay at the Red Lion.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: anacaona1804
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay. It was comfortable. There's a gym on the 5th floor, and a pub right downstairs. The location is great. It's in the heart of downtown Seattle and just a few short block away from Pike Place Market. You can even walk to the Space Needle in about 20 mins. Parking is $35 per day.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff great stay”
Reviews.Author: SINBADNOBLE
Reviews.Content: Stay 6 July 09. Front desk let us check in early. Apox. 10:45 AM. Very helpful staff all round. Check in was fast. Room was good sized and clean. Bed was king size and just right for us. Not to soft and not to hard. Bathroom was large and clean. Room temp control was great. View of the water was somewhat limited but did not go to Seattle for the room view. Over all the whole hotel was very clean. Staff presented it self well. Very pleased with our stay and will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: laringer
Reviews.Content: I believe that the hotel just got finished w/ renovations. It was really nice - not overly done up but definitely a step above the typical hotel room. Location was key because we didn't want to rental a car. Everything we wanted to see/do was easily in walking distance or bus stops were nearby (public transportation was so convenient). The hotel front desk personnel was fantastic and always helpful. Really a great stay overall. My only complaints was that the concierge never called us back once, wait staff on the patio at happy hour were not really attentive (although the manager was great for restaurant recommendations!) & when we specifically requested a taxi to take us to the airport – we kept getting steered to a town car which was more expensive (although the bell man & town car driver will tell you it's the same).

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: hsvet
Reviews.Content: We just got back from 5 nights at the Red Lion Hotel on Fifth Avenue in Seattle. We were in room 713. The bad things were that we had to call a maintenance man in 3 times because the heater/air conditioner was either too hot or too cold, and could not be adjusted. Other things were the dirty exterior windows with bird poop streaking down them. Also, the toilet was difficult to flush and the handle had to be held down hard for a long time to flush. Also, the room was poorly lit, with at least 2 lights not working and not able to be fixed, since it was due, according to the maintenance man, to a faulty wiring job when the hotel was remodeled. So, we had a hard time reading in the evening, and it was depressingly dim. On the first day, two of the four elevators were not working, so there were long lines at the elevators. I spent over twelve hundred dollars for the 5 nights, and when I checked out, when asked how I liked my stay, I told the receptionist I would never again go to a Red Lion Hotel, and it was worth only $100 a night. The good things were that the hotel was in a good location in downtown to walk around to the waterfront and go to the convention center, and the food we ate at the one meal we ate there was OK, not great.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: arnieman
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very, very well-situated for both business and leisure travelers, with easy access to the waterfront, Pike Street Market, Art Museum, and Convention Center. Downtown Seattle is fairly compact, and is well-serviced by (free) bus routes on most of its avenues and many of its streets. The hotel is within walking distance of many sites and nice restaurants. (My wife and I discovered the cafe at Macy's, about a five minute walk, was excellent for breakfast or lunch, with tasty and reasonably-priced sandwiches and soup, and quick and efficient service. The service at the Red Lion was excellent, especially the front desk, which went above and beyond the call of duty when I had problems printing out boarding passes for our return flight home. The room, for which we paid a small extra amount, was on a high floor with a delightful view of Elliott Bay and the arriving and departing Washington State Ferries. The king bed had excellent linens, a decent-sized work desk, and an easy chair. It also had a small fridge and a coffee maker. The bathroom was a tad small, but one usually doesn't live in the bathroom. The shower was adequate in terms of hot water and water pressure. The only negative about the room was the table lamps on the nightstans, which could use higher capacity light bulbs. I didn't bring my laptop, but I believe that wireless access has a daily charge. The hotel is a five minute walk from the Sheraton Hotel, where one can get on or off the airporter bus. The latter is $18 for a roundtrip, and if you have a little extra time is well worth the savings over an airport taxi if you have a party of two or fewer. (The bus will take you about 45" to/from the airport, about 15-20" more than a taxi; the bus runs every half hour.) As leisure activity we would certainly recommend the Museum of Art, but would suggest you skip the Olympic Garden, which was underwhelming at best. The Happy Hour at The Brooklyn Restaurant was excellent - good and inexpensive drinks and food, good service, and a happy, noisy but not raucus atmosphere. (Based upon the Happy Hour food I would think the restaurant, which is of the fine dining class, would be an excellent choice for either seafood or beef.) The Red Lion seemed to be less expensive than many of the competitors in its class, and we would not hesitate to recommend it for leisure or business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Location with Comfort & Style in Newly-Refurbished Room”
Reviews.Author: SimonPaul
Reviews.Content: After a long flight and the usual waits at US Immigration, the Red Lion came as a welcome relief. We had booked an Executive Tower Room, which gave us a wonderful 18th floor view of Elliott Bay & Puget Sound. And all this just two blocks from the central shopping area and only 10 minutes walk to Pike Place Marked The room seemed newly refurbished and, despite the fact the hotel had given us a king rather than twin room (which was Expedia's fault not theirs), it was both comfortable and value. Red Lion had been offering good discounts online in what otherwise seemed an expensive city for hotels, so the stylish room in the end seemed pretty good value. The staff were unfailingly polite, helpful and overall the hotel seemed more than the 3.5 stars that it claimed. A delightful first couple of nights in a very pleasant city.

Reviews.Title: “loooved it!”
Reviews.Author: clumsykillinois
Reviews.Content: I was sooo impressed with the Red Lion hotel. My husband and I went to Seattle for part of our Honeymoon and loved everything about this hotel. The rooms were clean, the staff was great, and the location was excellent (we walked to the pike place market every day for fresh fruits/veggies). I definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable; great location”
Reviews.Author: redhills
Reviews.Content: Stayed here three nights for a ladies shopping trip. Paid the hotel web site AAA rate which was same as rate offered on Expedia. No bargains in high season downtown. Now that I know the 4 star hotels are all very centrally located I will try Priceline next time. We had a refurbished room with a view of Elliot Bay that was spacious and nicely decorated including refrigerator, free internet, daily paper--amenities you often pay for separately at Hilton, Hyatt, etc. Did not use room service or hotel restaurant. Good bakery across street for breakfast or lunch--pastries, fruit, egg breakfast sandwiches, etc. Plenty of restaurants within six block radius. For lunch enjoyed Icon Grill and Dahlia Lounge. Dinners, though each place had it's own personality, seemed over priced (Il Bistro, Flying Fish and Andalucca). As per other reviews, parking at the Red Lion runs $33/night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: texlady25
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Red Lion for two nights before our cruise. Everything was wonderful about the hotel, the location, the service and the decor. It looked like it was recently remodeled and very clean. It was very convenient to walk everywhere. We ate breakfast twice at the restaurant and it was very good. We were very pleased with our choice to stay here and it was the start of a wonderful trip.

Reviews.Title: “Can't go wrong with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: stjoebarb
Reviews.Content: We very much enjoyed our 7 day stay at the Red Lion. Very nice bed and towels. Small refrig in room. Nice fitness room. Hardly ever had to wait for an elevator. Concierge was very helpful - she booked our trip to Victoria and also dinner at Salty's - a bus picked us up and drove us over - great view of the city from across the water. Because of the location I know we would stay there again. We liked the Pub Happy Hour - did not try the restaurant on 5th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in downtown Seattle”
Reviews.Author: hollholl
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Red Lion while in town for a meeting at the Convention Center. The location was perfect -- just a couple of blocks away from the Convention Center, not far from the waterfront (great if you're a jogger like me), and near plenty of stores and restaurants too. My room was spacious and clean and included free wi-fi (I hate when hotels charge for that!). I was really impressed with the lighting in my bathroom which actually was flattering and good for applying make-up, unlike most hotel bathroom lights. My room was missing an ironing board, but housekeeping brought one up right away. I didn't try the restaurants but I did work out in the fitness room which was small but pleasant and had all the basic necessities. The desk staff was for the most part very friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay there again if I were in Seattle and recommend it to fellow business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Super Location”
Reviews.Author: Travellers_8
Reviews.Content: This is really a lovely older hotel - right in the city centre. Our room was beautifully decorated and very clean. The hotel staff seemed pleasant. This is really a great hotel for the money. Just a couple of drawbacks: We had a problem with our heating. They sent someone up right away, but it still seemed cool. I see others have complained about heating in their reviews There's no pool The $35 parking fee is exhorbitant. If its workable for you, parking on the street is free after 6pm and on Sundays.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Rajatkn
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel after reading some reviews on trip advisor and recommendations from my fellow colleagues who have stayed in this hotel before. I enjoyed my 15 days stay here and have received good hospitality from the hotel staff, guidance on some day trips during the weekend and helping me in getting everyday transportation arranged for my office. Their staff is very friendly and understanding and they care for their guests. I'll definetly recommend this property to my colleagues. Thanks Rajat

Reviews.Title: “Barely 3 Stars, nothing fancy..”
Reviews.Author: bowman716
Reviews.Content: I travel twice a year to Seattle on business. Stayed for 6 days. The good stuff: $85.00 per night is a steal for downtown Seattle. Pleasant staff. Everthing worked in the room and the bed (bedding) was good quality. Clean, well maintained public areas and bright hallways. Great location to shopping, convenction center and Pike Place Market. Area's of disappointment: No bellman. No conceeair. 5th floor restaurant; slow service and food was cold both times I ate there. Inadequate light and dark furnishings make rooms look poor. No lotion provided in bathroom or full length mirror. Very loud, room doors have no seals. You hear all voices and other doors slamming shut. TV must be replaced! Dark picture tube and bad reception. No HBO and/or Showtime. On Demand options are very limited.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: raeaela
Reviews.Content: We visited Seattle in May of 2008. Our stay at the Red Lion on 5th was the best hotel experience ever. We booked it on priceline by naming our own price and got it for $75 a night. We took the train from eugene, and took a cab to the hotel (about $15). We had heard that parking was expensive ($35 a/night?) so we walked everywhere from then on and skipped getting a rental until the last day when we needed it to go to a Mariners game and get back to amtrack with all our luggage. The mattresses were so nice i want to get the same kind at home! There were complimentary Bath and Body Works mini shampoos and such, we got the coconut scent. My boyfriend forgot his toothbrush, and they had spares for free that they sent up. The room had a fridge, and coffeemaker. I dont remeber if there was a microwave though. We had a city view, but then we didnt come to look out the window. The hotel is within walking distance of the Pikes Place market, where we ate breakfast most days at a little french bakery. We even walked up to capitol hill for a concert at Chop Suey, although i wouldnt recommend the walk. It was exhausting. We walked to the monarail that went to the space needle, experience music program, and the pacific science center. These were all a ton of fun. If you want to go to alot of the museums (EMP/space needle etc) get an entertainment book online for the seattle area. There were a ton of buy one get one free coupons in it. We really saved alot of money doing this. Overall this is the best hotel i have ever stayed in (and ive traveled alot). It was so comfy and the staff was really nice and the location was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Chicasmum
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 4 nights in a King Room. The first night the room (facing 5th on Level 9) was unbelievably hot - the room aircon could not be regulated. It continued to pump out hot air, very noisily, all night. Very unpleasant. Next morning we complained and immediately were offered another room on Level 14 - with a nice view of the water - where the aircon was perfect. We had a small problem with the shower - the water kept re-diverting to the bath, but that was fixed no problems. One very annoying thing was with the bed - very comfortable - but the bottom fitted sheet seemed to be too small as every night it came off the mattress and my husband ended up laying directly on the mattress and thee bottom sheet and mattress cover was all bunched up- they need to invest in better bed linen. Free wi-fi was good. Great location and we would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable, central hotel”
Reviews.Author: abcdHalifax
Reviews.Content: Great base for exploring Seattle, which is a very fun and vibrant city! Close to Pike Place Market. Very nice check-in staff.

Reviews.Title: “average hotel advertised as upscale...pffft”
Reviews.Author: savalox
Reviews.Content: terrible television and channel selections. It cost 30.00 to park per day which should be considered fraud. They don't tell you about the parking fee until they get their mitts on your credit card. I know a good hotel and price for a hotel when i see it. I would recomend Comfort Suites on Roy st.....Save your self 40% and get a great hotel and more friendly staff. I have stayed and numerous Red Lions.....They are off my list.

Reviews.Title: “Decent rooms, great location”
Reviews.Author: pete_wendy
Reviews.Content: Great location within walking distance to shops, restaurants and Pike Place market. The room itself was just average – not great but not bad either. I think a 3-star rating would be more appropriate as the hotel was pretty standard. Our room had a small kitchenette with a refrigerator which was nice. Everything was clean and we have no complaints. There was a bit of construction going on while we were there (September 2008) outside of the main entrance to the hotel which was not very attractive. If you want to sleep in or work in your room past 8 am I would check to see if the construction is still going on as it gets very loud in the morning (especially if your room is facing the street). The hotel has its own terrace restaurant on the 5th floor and there is also a restaurant/bar called the Elephant & Castle directly downstairs. We did not eat at the hotel restaurant (because of reviews) but the Elephant & Castle had decent food and a strawberry shortcake to die for! The hotel offers a parking garage for $30 per 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Excited about the location, neutral about everything else...”
Reviews.Author: Elchie
