Reviews.Content: The downtown location of the Red Lion is hard to beat: you're in the center of shopping, there's plenty of restaurants, and Pike Market is just a few blocks away. The hotel itself, however, is on the bland side. Rooms are spacious, but generic. The lobby is an odd mix of living room and ski lodge (the fire place in July seemed a bit unnecessary) and a bit too hectic to actually be a place where guests would come down to relax. Agree with the other reviewers that the elevators can be painfully slow, but disagree with those who found the staff unfriendly/inattentive.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, minor issues”
Reviews.Author: pvg
Reviews.Content: My husband and I came here for a few days to visit his company headquarters. I worked for two solid days in the hotel. Generally the stay was better than expected, given some of the reviews on Tripadvisor. Pluses 1. Rooms were pretty clean, lots of space, and had appropriate amenities. 2. I was in the room when housekeeping came each day and they did a good job cleaning quickly and quietly (I was on the phone most of the time). 3. Hot breakfast buffet was included each day, although choices were relatively limited. We opted not to have breakfast the second day. 4. Room service for lunch was fast and hot. Menu has some good choices. 5. Customer service was generally courteous and friendly. 6. Fantastic location downtown, just a few blocks from Pike Place and one block from Westlake. Lots of great restaurants and shopping around here. Minuses 1. We had problems with outbound calls. First night we tried one phone and had to have the front desk "release" the line for outbound calls. Second day I tried another phone and had to call again to get it released. This one never worked, so I usedmy cell phone the entire time I was here. 2. The room is not really set up for working. No speaker phone or mute capability. 3. TV didn't work one morning; all the channels were snow. 4. Pay movies didn't work; got a message that the movie had to be ordered at the front desk. Called to ask them to order it and they said they'd take care of it. Movie never started. 5. Water pressure and heat are acceptable but lower than we'd like. 6. We were two doors down from the elevator, so we could hear people noise when they were waiting outside. Fortunately not too much noise from neighbors (although the headboards rattle anytime you move on the bed). 7. Within a few blocks of the hotel you can find a lot of vagrants and other people at loose ends. When we had dinner last night just a couple blocks away, two bike cops were frisking and interrogating two young men right against the window where our table was situated. 8. Pike Place Market shuts down at the end of the day, so don't wait to see it at night. I would consider staying here again if the rate were right ($250-300 seems steep).

Reviews.Title: “Rocks for pillows”
Reviews.Author: FlRo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the hotel during Aug 08 for 6 nights. The pillows were like rocks, the beds were hard, and the sheets were a rough poly-cotton blend, and the towels were like sandpaper. We stayed on the 20th floor, executive tower, Bay view side. We checked in on a Sunday afternoon and the Fire Alarms sounded at about 2:30 AM Monday morning. We evacuated down the stairwell to the lobby. After the 'All Clear' was announced by the evening / night Manager I inquired as to the cause of the alarm. His comment was someone was smoking in one of the rooms on the 20th floor; he just was not sure witch room. A multi-million dollar hotel and they don’t know which room - that is frightening! We returned to our room and the alarm went off again about 1/2-hour later. By the way; parking is $30.00 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Downtown”
Reviews.Author: Edgewatertraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in July 08. We were on the 18th floor with a great view of the Sound. Everything is within walking distance and you can take advantage of the free bus in the downtown area...this made life much easier after a long day of exploring. Also you can get the bus 174 from the airport which drops you right around the corner. Not bad for $1.50...instead of a $30 cab ride. The room was nice and the service was very helpful. I wouldn't recommend the pub downstairs for dinner as the food wasn't great...but I'm sure for a drink or two very enjoyable. Overall we would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Adequate Service”
Reviews.Author: Nelspark
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel with our two young sons for two nights in July. The hotel is very central to most of what you'd want to see in downtown Seattle. We found the hotel to be very clean, however while we were there apparently two elevators were broken which meant waits for up to 5 minutes during busy times. The concierge was often non-existent, and the staff were okay. It wasn't exceptional, but for the price and the location, it was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Super comfy beds!!!”
Reviews.Author: tosaro
Reviews.Content: It is a 20 floor hotel in the middle of Seattle's financial district. The hotel itself has a small lobby with fireplace and four elevators to access the rooms (with one elevator to access the underground parking garage). There is a hotel restaurant on the 5th floor, which also boasts a large garden terrace overlooking the Sound. It's a great place for a drink and apps. There is also a restaurant you can access from the hotel (The Elephant & Castle), but it is not affiliated with the hotel. Also, there is a gym on site, but no pool. We were warmly greeted upon check-in and we asked for the 'best room'. We had a corner room on the 20th floor, away from the elevators and ice machine. It was spacious, quiet and clean. The beds were the most comfortable beds we've ever encountered in a hotel. Pillow tops!!! The bathroom was a bit on the small side, but large enough to do what one needs to do in a bathroom. The room also had a small 'fridge, separate bar sink and a couple of cotton robes for our use. :-) The hotel was smack-dab in the middle of everything. It is a couple blocks to Pike's Market, Nordstrom's, the Monorail, shops, restaurants, etc.... It is in a great location. The only negative thing in the entire week was poor maid service the last 2 days of our 6 night trip. The 5th night we didn't get any toiletries (ie..toilet paper!!!) and the 6th night our room was never made up, despite us being gone from 10a - 5pm. If you need a taxi, work with the Bell Captain. It's not easy to find a free taxi in downtown. They are super helpful. They even arranged a private car for us to get back to the airport - at the same price we paid for a taxi to get to the hotel!!! I would recommend this hotel to anyone, without doubt!

Reviews.Title: “Good value!”
Reviews.Author: cabes2
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel for the price. The staff was friendly. The girl provided me a free upgrade upon check in because they did not have any more rooms available at my rate of about $120 per night from Hotwire. The bed was comfortable and the room was clean. However, a little remodeling and a pool would be nice! Anyway, I would recommend this hotel if paying a modest price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Sheannb
Reviews.Content: I was lucky to book The Red Lion on Fifth Avenue and pay only $60.00 total through Priceline! The room was very large, had robes, coffee pot, etc. The beds and pillows were very, very comfortable. We ate at the Elephant and Castle Pub below the hotel and the food was reasonably priced and very good. Location was wonderful. Only a 5 block walk to Pike Market Place - which we went to a few times. Only a 3 block walk to the monorail to the Space Needle. The staff were very nice and helpful on check-in and when one of our suitcases was delayed. My husband lost his cell phone and we returned to the Red Lion after our cruise to Alaska and his phone was in the lost & found and never used! Staff were efficient and friendly. This was our first trip to Seattle and we enjoyed it even more by staying at the Red Lion on Fifth Avenue!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, location, comfy beds”
Reviews.Author: dsj5777
Reviews.Content: Booked on Hotwire. Central to public transportation including shuttle from airport (stop one block away) qne underground and above ground busses within (two blocks). which for free will get you around central Seattle. Central to Pike Place, monorail, Pacific Place, etc. Inside the front desk was friendly at check in, the room ample sized, bed and pillows comfortable, and the room was clean and kept clean for our 4 night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location”
Reviews.Author: sng8888
Reviews.Content: Off the 3 starts hotels possible on a hotel bidding site, this was the most closest to the city center. Rooms were surprisingly large and clean. Rates are excellent when we bidding (I recall $67/ night). Good usable gym and proximity of all downtown shopping. An added bonus was that I could pick up a free wifi signal. Parking is expensive ($27per night) which isn't unexpected for downtown. Beds were very good. Rooms were quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value, dated decor”
Reviews.Author: Abel73
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 5 nights to attend a conference. The Seattle Convention Center is just a couple of blocks away, and so is everything else in the downtown area! including Pike Place Market, the water front, hundreds of restaurants, stores, and of course coffee shops! The hotel is probably one of the best 3 stars I've seen. The decor is dated and looks tired, but the rooms and common areas were clean. The lobby is big, with good lighting and a comfortable sitting area near a fire place. The staff was friendly and checking in was a simple process. If you have a car there is on-site parking. There is a restaurant on the 5th floor where I usually ate breakfast most days and lunch once, but only because my company paid for meals consumed at the hotel only, which was fine, but I would avoid eating there if you had to pay for it. There is also a pub / restaurant called Elephant and Castle in the lower level that connects with the hotel, but you cannot charge your bill to your hotel room there. I had a beer and Thai grilled chicken salad there for dinner once and both were good. There is a small but well equipped fitness room, also on the 5th floor. The only real negative aspect is that the walls are "paper thin" and you can hear EVERYTHING that's going on in the room(s) next to you, and I assume they can hear what is going on in yours as well.

Reviews.Title: “As expected......”
Reviews.Author: gktmd2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a very nice location, central to restaurants and shopping. The check-in was quick and efficient. The front desk clerk was professional. The room was quite nice and the bed comfortable. There is a lot of noise from the other rooms and the hallway as others have noted. The decor is a bit outdated. The restaurant is on the fifth floor and looked nice but I did not eat there. I reserved the room through priceline. I would stay there again if I needed a solid 3 star room but I dont htink it is worth the "rack" rates quoted on their website.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel (avoid the restaurant though)”
Reviews.Author: Wildholdy
Reviews.Content: I too was worried when I got this downtown hotel on priceline ($60/night - probably could get it for $50/night, I was doing 4stars and just dropped it down to 3 without changing the price), but was surprised at how well we were treated (not labeled as priceliners and banished to a basement room near the water heaters). We checked in at noon and the lady there was really nice and put us on whatever floor we wanted. When we entered the room it was still messy and it looked like people were still staying there - luckily no one was in there at the time so we just slowly backed out. Anyway, when we went back down to mention that the room was still occupied the lady at the desk upgraded us to a water view room for free and was just really nice. The water view room was nice because you could watch the ferries come and go at night and you could see pikes place and the sun (when it was out) was really nice on the water (there was a lot of construction in our view too, but hey..free upgrade?). Other nice things that lady did for us: gave us change for bigger bills so we could use the bus, found out which bus to take when we wanted to get to other areas or the airport (the 194 to the airport was only like $2 and it stops 2 blocks from the hotel), printed our boarding passes and was just really nice. I'd stay here again, but just if I got it through priceline - hey I'm cheap. Do avoid hotel dining though: we decided to try it out since we were soaked and freezing one night and didn't have time to change and get out to another place - overpriced and gross (rubbery chicken, tasteless sandwiches, overpriced hot chocolate (a swiss miss packet tossed into a cup of tepid water). If you don't want to stray far just go across the street to palamino's (good italian food for less than the hotel). The food was my only regret.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: hmoney
Reviews.Content: Got an excellent deal from www.hotwire.com (can't choose what room type though). Only $96 including tax! Hotel is walking distance to everything downtown. Had a room with 2 queen beds on the top (20th floor). Room has mini bar with small fridge & sink. Even a built in bottle opener. Old Zenith tv but we were out sightseeing anyway. Bathroom was average size. Great complimentary products from Bed, Bath & Beyond. Lobby is nicely decorated. Downside, no pool and parking is a bit expensive at $28/day, but you do have in/out priviledges. Elephant & Castle Pub in the hotel is great! Try the 3 appies for $16! Would definately stay here again! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Good location!”
Reviews.Author: TeoMilano
Reviews.Content: Good location. Average room, enough clean. Nice staff. The garage is too expensive (28 $ per night!).

Reviews.Title: “What a Great Find!”
Reviews.Author: PGarcia
Reviews.Content: The Red Lion Hotel on Fifth Avenue has many features you'll seek when visiting Seattle. It's smack in the middle of the city's terrific shopping district, so Nordstrom, Macy's, and many other popular specialty shops and fine restaurants are within walking distance. Just down the hill is Pike Street Market. The hotel itself is comfortable and looks recently updated. My standard room was excellent, with coffee maker and refrigerator included. The lobby has free cookies and coffee (for December, hot cider is served). Downstairs is a pub with reasonably priced food. I wish the hotel had a gift shop, but Walgreens and Rite Aid are within a block of the hotel. Every Red Lion Hotel I've stayed in has offered great value and the Seattle location is no exception. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - Red Lion Downtown”
Reviews.Author: finsinque
Reviews.Content: Red Lion on 5th St. - Seattle Washington Very good location - walking distance from the waterfront and to the shops and eating places on Robson St. three blocks away. Lobby - unassuming. I did like the fact they gave me 15 minutes free on the internet in the lobby. concierge was very helpful in getting us a cab, telling us where to go - giving us a map Room was large - lots of pillows, better than what I am use to. Security - had to use room card to get on the elevator Overall - fine experience Fin Sinque

Reviews.Title: “Room with a view”
Reviews.Author: stin96
Reviews.Content: Booking this on priceline and never before staying in downtown Seattle we were a little worried. Our price for a three star was accepted and we could not have made a better score with the Red Lion. We had a view of the water and the mountains, a beautiful spacious room and great service. Very clean, comfy bed, free wi fi, nice lobby area. The only down side was the $26.00 per night parking fee. No need for a car and next time we won't bother to rent one especially if we are staying in the downtown area. This hotel is very centrally located. As we were checking out the couple next to us commented that they had stayed at the Hilton the night before and paid considerable more than they paid at the Red Lion and felt the Red Lion was as good if not better.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Even Better Location!”
Reviews.Author: rmcl26
Reviews.Content: Never heard of Red Lion prior to this trip. We were suprisingly happy with the hotel. The bed and linens were great, and the room was extremely comfortable. The hotel is located right in the middle of the shopping district and only a few blocks from Pikes Market. Again, great hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: BrianM55
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 3 nights recently at the Red Lion. The hotel is very centrally located in downtown Seattle, close to all tourist attractions. The hotel itself was very comfortable. Our room was spacious and clean. Any staff we dealt with were very friendly and helpful. This is a great place to stay if you want to be in the downtown area. We do not hesitate in recommending the Red Lion on 5th and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mjr223
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 1 night over Labor Day weekend. The room was clean and comforable, parking was pricy ($26) but close, safe, and most important, available. The location was great, walking distance to everything we wanted to see (Pike Place Market, Art Museum, shopping, etc.) The front desk was very helpful, providing recomendations and reservations for dinner. The only downside was both a the time we checked in and the time we checked out no one was available to help with our luggage. At check in we waited in our room until they called with someone available. At check out in the morning we wanted to get started early and all the luggage carriers in the lobby were full so we hauled our own stuff out.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for downtown”
Reviews.Author: Minski1974
Reviews.Content: Spent the Labor Day Long Weekend seeing the sites and shops of Seattle. Read the reviews and though not my first choice (booked), we're very satisfied with our 3-night stay. Got in late Friday, great front-desk, quickly assigned our room, 1503. Amazing unit with view down Pike Ave, the water and islands beyond! Comfortablish King bed, nice sized room and fantastic bathroom goodies. Towels smelled like brown sugar! Check out was okay, as they were processing our payment for incidentals I noticed they missed the water ($6 bucks?) and commented on it. The girl actually bothered to recharge our card a second time, which we felt was a bit cheap given they had missed it anyways. Concierge was good, so was Bell Clerk. We'd consider staying here again, but I'll be sure to keep my observations to myself next time!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised by the Red Lion.”
Reviews.Author: schiller60610
Reviews.Content: Booked a 1-night stay at the last minute through Priceline and was pleasantly surprised. Room was spacious and beautifully furnished -- the most comfortable mattresses that we've slept on in a long time and 4 big pillows on each bed. Good quality bed linens. Nice bathroom amenities from Bath and Body Works, plus tea/coffee station. A bit of a drag to have to pay for parking. Bell captain loaned us umbrellas for strolling down to Pike Place Market and over to the Bell Town neighborhood (very cool). Well positioned for shopping and exploring on foot, although there is a large # of street people between the hotel and the market. Still, would definitely use the hotel again as a base in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Happy stay at the Red Lion”
Reviews.Author: lsmlady
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Red Lion on business. The location is great, close to shopping and restaurants and right in the thick of things. My view was wonderful, I could see the space needle and the water. The staff was courteous and efficient. Parking cost 26.00 for the night and was good until 4pm on the day of checkout. The bed was comfortable and the hotel was very quiet. The toilet didn't work, but they sent someone to fix it immediately. The restaurant is OK, the price is reasonable but other places like triple doors (next to wild ginger) serve much better food. The room was typical hotel: adequate but nothing fancy. The Crowne Plaza in downtown Seattle had a bigger room, better furnishings, more TV channels, and a better exercise room. I stayed there the previous night and would have extended my stay at the location, but they were full. See my review of that property for comparison.

Reviews.Title: “Walls are Paper Thin!”
Reviews.Author: Light7Sleeper
Reviews.Content: I could easily hear the people in the next room regardless of what they were doing (talking, moving stuff around, etc...). The doors were very loud when people entered / left their rooms. I could hear doors shutting way down the hall. This made it very difficult to sleep as people were coming and going up until 2:00 AM. If you are a light sleeper, I do not recommend this hotel. As far as noise levels, this is the worst of all the hotels I have stayed. I travel a good bit for work. I will not stay here again. If you have no troubles sleeping or don't mind doors slamming, everything else about this hotel was good.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Attractive Downtown Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ricosuave760
Reviews.Content: We arrived for a four night stay during the fourth of July holiday week in 2007. We were quite pleased with the attractiveness and cleanliness of the hotel. The front desk and bell staff were very friendly and attentive to our needs. We were a little disappointed with the concierge staff, never received a smile or greeting when he was seated alone at his desk as we passed by. The room was very nice and had a very comfortable king bed with 6 comfy pillows. The bathroom had great soap/shampoo amenities and look forward to buying them for my home. The restaurant was the most disappointing experience. During happy hour we ordered a couple drinks, and was served a cosmopolitan in a chipped, leaking glass. The server didn't notice it and quickly left as he set the drinks down. We had to go search for him to let him know about the broken glass. The service was very slow and there was no reason for it either. Nobody was dining in the restaurant and there were 3 waiters who were handling about 8 tables. On our second adventure to the restaurant/bar, we were acnowledged when entering but were completely ignored when we were seated. After 5 minutes, we got up and left and went outside the hotel for our dinner. Housekeeping did a good job for the most part. However, we didn't receive any service on our last night and I had to contact the front desk. They sent somebody who did a haphazard job of restocking the towels and soap amenities, but didn't clean the room in the same style that we had experienced the previous three nights. Hotel has a convenient location in downtown Seattle and is just steps away from world class shopping and dining.

Reviews.Title: “Tired, Worn and Needs Attention”
Reviews.Author: jharve
Reviews.Content: Although I had a wonderful view of the water, this hotel needs a face-lift. The rooms need to be re-done, the carpeting is old and worn. The bed was not as bad as I had read about being on a hammock, but the hotel as a whole needs attention. The main restaurant is very disappointing, with very slow service and not a great menu. Not that it is key, but it would be a plus if more television stations were offered, such as HBO, as well. It is very well located and has a nice little pub under it. It could be so much more with a little work.

Reviews.Title: “Slept in a Hammock”
Reviews.Author: Hotelcritiques
Reviews.Content: The bed could be likened to sleeping in a hammock. The fire alarm was accidently set off at 5 a.m. It took an incredible amount of time to resolve the issue. After the ear piercing room alarms were finally turned off, the front desk after making their announcement, FORGOT TO TURN OFF THE INTERCOM. Resulting in 5 more minutes of front desk chit chat about the entire ordeal and how one's voice sounds on the intercom. No hot tub or spa. The shower sends out spurts of scaulding water followed by cold water. Other tenants experienced the same thing. Management was unable to resolve any issue presented. To call the exercise room or room service a number of 1085 is given in the hotel guest book. However, any number you dial takes you directly to the front desk... go figure. Your call may or may not be directly directed! Fortunately, the location is superb.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: tripmember888
Reviews.Content: Was booked at the Red Lion Hotel for a conference after the original hotel I had reserved had construction delays. Stayed for two nights, and had a spacious corner room on the tenth floor with two queen beds and a wet bar area with refrigerator. Free wireless internet access in the room and the hotel, which worked fine. Room was clean, good beds, no HBO but an above average cable channel selection. Wasn't bothered by noise from other rooms (I think the noise problem is worse if you have a door to an adjoining room). Parking $25 a night, but with in/out privileges--occasionally crowded and needing valet assistance. Staff was friendly. Great location an easy walk to PIke Place Market, two blocks from the convention center. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend trip to the 5th Ave. Theater”
Reviews.Author: Cheryl206
Reviews.Content: We stayed here overnight and everything was great. Comfy beds and pillows. Right down the street from the theater. Easy walk to a restaurant nearby. Pricey parking, but we could keep our car in the garage until 4pm the next day after checkout. Easy walk to Pike Place Market on a sunny spring NW day. Front desk - very nice. Bell hops and conceirge - friendly. Asked for a high floor to avoid street noise and could still hear cars, but slept like a baby. Clean room. Would stay here again and recommend.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay in the city!”
Reviews.Author: rosario07
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a weekend get away. I was pleasantly surprised the hotel was right in the middle of everything! The location is awesome but parking was rediculously high (24/night). I actually just parked a block away at a meter (free after six and six dollars for four hours (starting at 9am mon-sat), enough time to walk and shop around downtown). The room was a good size for two people. Had a comfortable queen size bed w/lots of down-filled pillows. The only downside was the semi-clogged drain in the shower. Didn't call to complain, just took quick showers. We would definitely come back again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, great location.”
Reviews.Author: jeg-reiser
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised with this hotel, especially since I got a great deal through priceline. The rooms were clean and the staff was friendly. The hotel is in a great location in downtown Seattle. You can walk to tons of restaurants, shops, bars, etc. The hotel is on in a main area, so you can feel safe knowing you're not on some deserted side street. There is parking under the hotel, which is $25/night. It seems expensive, but we didn't see anywhere else to park. There is a small loading/unloading area right in front of the hotel. But, if you plan to keep your car there, you should go straight into the garage. The rooms have a small fridge, coffee maker, and a bar/sink area. We stayed there for 7 days, and one of the nights there was a fire in the kitchen. So, at 4am we had to evacuate the hotel. The hotel has an intercom system that the fire dept used to let us know to evacuate (plus there was a loud alarm). We got clear directions of exactly what to do through the intercom. The hotel provided coffee and food for us while we were waiting for the 'ok' to go back up to the rooms. Even though it sucked having to be jolted out of bed b/c of a fire alarm, you should rest assured that if something was seriously wrong with the building, you would know about it and be able to get out. My only complaint would be the expensive parking. Other than that, I had no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, if you're not paying too much”
Reviews.Author: kuma668
Reviews.Content: My wife booked our stay through Priceline, and we (luckily) ended up with the Red Lion Hotel on Fifth Avenue. Located on Fifth Avenue (who knew?) between Pike and Union, this properties biggest benefit is it's location. Only 5 blocks from Pike's Market, and surrounded by shopping and places to eat. Oh, and if you like coffee, be careful, there are only approximately 3 coffee shops per square inch, so you may have to stock up between footsteps. The room was on the small side, but not unexpected of hotels in big cities, where room count is a question of economics. The other bad part of the room is that it had thin walls. The wireless internet access was free and decent, but had sporradic issues at times. Parking in the underground lot is $25.00 per day (plus a couple bucks in taxes), and you are free to come and go as you please. Just make sure the front desk is aware that you will be using the parking garage so they can get you the proper tags. If you book through an airline that you print your own boarding pass, be advised the business center charges $4.95 for 15 minutes, and $.49 per page to print. (I think it was $1.49 for color). The pillows were understuffed down pillows, something I'm not a big fan of, but even my wife thought they were too soft. The bed was medium firm. The room had adequate heating (we didn't try the A/C, it was cold enough as it was). The blackout curtains did a pretty good job. Water pressure and flow was pretty good. We didn't note any draining or filling problems. The Terrace restaurant was closed for remodeling while we were there, so I can't comment on it's quality. There is an English styled pub called the Elephant & Castle that is attached that was good quality. (Though they were lacking in a good selection of English brews at the time) All in all, it was a pretty good hotel at the price we paid ($80.00/per night, plus fees/taxes). I was really satisfied with the hotel at the price, but the normal price seems to be around $180/night, which I would have been furious at, as the value was nowhere near $180/night, especially when you have to add parking.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room but beware of phony telephone charge!”
Reviews.Author: hdt
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business trip for several days. The room is pretty nice and clean, but I when I checked my bill I found that there was a charge for a long distance telephone call that I never made. When I called the front desk to inquire about it, they gave me a number (--) and a time that the call was made. I never made such a call. When I called the number on my cell phone to check, it turned out to be an invalid number and the call could not get through. When I called the front desk back to tell them that, they quickly told me "not to worry about it", and they would "take care of it". Sounds a little fishy? So if you stay here, check your bill for any fake telephone charges!

Reviews.Title: “some good and some bad”
Reviews.Author: CompulsiveOverpacker
Reviews.Content: The good: 1. location, 2. location, 3. location. The bad: 1. The supposed wireless Internet access did not work in my room, which was a serious problem because I was there on business, and I needed to stay in touch with the office during my stay. When I told the front desk staff (multiple times, because it never got fixed), each staff member told me a slightly different story about how to access it. They all guaranteed me their way would work, but it never did. Eventually, a manager told me to call tech support to report a problem with their wireless coverage. Why it was my responsibility to report their problem, I don't know, but I just didn't have the time to call. Tip: go to the Juan Valdez coffee shop right next to the hotel if you need to get online. Access is free, and the environment is nice. 2. Upon checkout, the front desk did not split up the bill the way my roommate and I asked to have it split up. They split it up their own way without asking us how to do it, and then told us they couldn't change it because it was already done. To make a long story short, my roommate ended up spending about $150 more than me (even though we wanted the bill split up evenly), and she will not be able to get reimbursed by her employer for that extra amount. 3. The shower drain was very slow. Minor compared to #1 and #2, but I just don't like wading in a pool of dirty water while I'm trying to clean up. 4. Noise, both from the elevator shaft and from the rooms sharing walls with our room, made it difficult to sleep, at least for a light sleeper like myself.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, A Little Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: EC_Traveller
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Red Lion for an extended Labor Day getaway. The hotel was in a great location downtown. The room size was fine and generally clean but the bathroom could use updating and an good cleaning. If you can find this hotel for an extremely well discounted rate it was fine but I felt the discounted rate we rec'd from the hotel's web site was a higher price than I would ever pay again for a similar property. Have fun in Seattle, it's a great place to visit.

Reviews.Title: “So So Experience”
Reviews.Author: Mary5
Reviews.Content: Visited Red Lion on 5th Avenue for a one night stay. Whilst the hotel is in a great location for visiting Pike Place and the shopping areas and the rooms are quite nice, I have to agree that for the price this hotel was really not worth it. We paid $199 US per night plus taxes. The person we dealt with at check in ( Ryan ) was very miserable and impersonal. Really needs some customer service training. This is the noisiest hotel I have ever stayed in. The walls must be made of paper as the people in the next room REALLY were enjoying themselves, if you know what I mean!!!!!! The elevators were close by and were also going all night. The showers made a very loud vibrating sound when switched on not tonly in our room but all the rooms above and below us. Needless to say we would never stay at this property again. I did not sleep at all that night which did not make for a very restful start to my Alaskan Cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Small Rooms, Uncomfortable Beds”
Reviews.Author: blueflier
Reviews.Content: I will probably not stay here again. Even though it was a business trip (and this is certainly a business hotel), most business hotels now offer some level of comfort or try to make you feel at home. The service was patronizing, the rooms were tiny, the beds were awfully uncomfortable. The rooms weren't cleaned by 2:00 p.m. Even for a business hotel, it was pretty expensive for what you get. There were a couple of things that did work: the location for business at Pike Place Market and downtown/CBD is great. Free wi-fi is also nice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value. Large room. Great location. I'd stay again.”
Reviews.Author: Global_Coug
Reviews.Content: I lived in Seattle for 12 years and, trust me, the location is just fine for downtown sights. You're walking distance from the shopping areas, Pike Place Market, and the ferry boats/Ivar's. You can walk to the monorail for a ride to the Space Needle, or take a cheap cab ride there. For business, there are a number of hotels that are very close to the financial district. This one is one of the best in that regard. I stayed here one night on business then my family arrived for two more nights. Very nice (eggs, waffles, etc) free breakfast buffet. Good happy hour. Service was very slow. Ditto for the front desk. Poor on answering calls for information. Management needs to focus on this, but I find that this is a problem at all but the most upscale properties in cities. The room was excellent. My wife and I both commented it would be a $500 room in New York. Very roomy, clean. Free high speed internet. Bathroom was a B; totally functional, a bit in need of updating, but well above average. Sadly, when they converted this former bank building to a hotel, they didn't put any sound insulation in the room walls. Maybe a bit worse than average among better business hotels in this regard, but still not bad. Paid $129 on a corporate rate. Incredible value.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, spacious, above 3 star”
Reviews.Author: ruffboots
Reviews.Content: Booked on Priceline for a substantial amount off list and I was surprised to find the Red Lion a quality hotel, clean and comfortable, with excellent service and a prime location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: tramoseats
Reviews.Content: Can't complain as long as you get a reasonable price. Clean and much less hectic than neighboring hotels. Room was bigger than average.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed but mostly good”
Reviews.Author: Britraveller
Reviews.Content: Just stayed 3 nights at the Red Lion Seattle. Plus points are location - very central location, excellent for shopping, safe area to walk around if a lady out and about shopping alone. Breakfast nice, clean, good complimentary wireless Internet access in room. Negative points, reception staff need some customer service training, at this price you expect a higher standard of customer care (got the impression they were happy to do what you wanted but didn't really go out of their way to be friendly, attentive etc) and also for the price, I would expect a better choice of TV channels in the room. Would go again if staying in Seattle but only if on business as couldn't justify paying the price out my own pocket. Paid $256 per night + tax - Internet special rate apparently...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: H20lvr
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful experience. Hotel was very clean. Location was great. Within walking distance to Pike's Market, the Pier, good shopping and restaurants. Contacted the Concierge before arrival and she had set up dinner reservations and limo service with Salty's on Saturday night. We had the best table in the house! Would highly recommend the Red Lion on 5th!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: canday7
Reviews.Content: Me(21) and My little sister(19) stayed there for 4 nights and paid for a half day rate on the fifth day, Our thoughts on the hotel were as followed: The hotel was nice. It was clean and had a great ac. We had a good window view. The location was great. We wanted to up grade, but since we booked with "priceline" we couldn't do it over the phone nor could we make any request, we would have to wait till we got to the hotel. The lady over the phone told me since we booked with "priceline" we kinda get the leftovers with rooms and what not. When we got there they already sold out on upgrades. Front desk agents were semi rude especially with the whole "priceline" package ordeal. Several comments were made about "priceline". Their restaurant on the 5th floor was nice and had a great server (his name I can not recall, but he was a younger sweet boy that catered to our requests). The bellman was extremely nice, so were two of the hotel operators (Terry and Goldy). The male concierge was also very nice and extremely friendly. The front desk didn't really cater to younger people, their first priority was their convention guest and older couples. Overall Seattle was amazing. The hotel was nice. Some of their staff should definitely work on their customer service skills. We may or may not stay there again. CM- Las Vegas, Nevada

Reviews.Title: “great location good hotel”
Reviews.Author: winniedoo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after a 7 day cruise. The location was perfect - across the street from an upscale mall, walking distances to Pike's and Piers. The hotel was very clean and the service was good. The lobby is perfect for lounging. There's a pub downstairs that has good food and two happy hours.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Catlover4
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 3-day stay @ the Red Lion. The location of this hotel is perfect! Right in the downtown area and blocks away from Pike Street Market. Great shopping around every corner. The room was fair, my only dissappointment with the room was the bathroom. There was a large area of mold on the ceiling above the shower/tub. A little bleach and some paint would have resolved the problem. The front desk staff was ok, but the female Concierge was unapproachable and rude. I would stay here again just because of the location.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel with great location and value”
Reviews.Author: MarioMexicoCity
Reviews.Content: I will give the Red Lion an excellent grade. Location is fantastic, dead-smack downtown and you can walk to all major attractions in the city. Rooms are nice, average-sized, clean and well appointed. As mentioned in other reviews, the staff is for the most part, surly and I really couldn't figure out why. Got it for US$60 a night++ at priceline so I was very satisfied with the value. Parking is a stiff $23 a nite but in line with all downtown Seattle parking. All in all I had a very good comfortable stay at the Red Lion.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: elmtree
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel after our Alaskan cruise and what an end to a wonderful week...Hotel was clean and the staff were very friendly..we got there early and they took our luggage and kept it for us while we walked down to Pike Place market and spend an excellent afternoon shopping and wondering around the market..We had never been to Seattle before, but we would love to come back and spend more time at the Red Lion Hotel and explore more of this wonderful city..

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Surly Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a nice, clean place to stay in a great location, however, when I told them I checked out and mention the shower had no hot water the woman at the front desk was unresponsive. They also tried to double bill me and their accounting department was snotty and rude. You would think they would have bookings through online services pretty much figured out. I would stay there if you get a good deal but be very clear about how you've paid and ask exactly what they're putting on you card, because the staff in fairly incompetent and kind of rude.

HotelInfo.Name: Red Lion Hotel on Fifth Avenue Seattle
HotelInfo.Address: 1415 Fifth Avenue, Seattle, WA 98101
